  90+ 6B92
  91+ 6B92 7C           madXAAddHLDESigned:     ld      a,h
  92+ 6B93 E6 80                                and     SignOnly8Bit
  93+ 6B95 47                                   ld      b,a                         ;save sign bit in b
  94+ 6B96 AA                                   xor     d                           ;if h sign and d sign were different then bit 7 of a will be 1 which means
  95+ 6B97                                      JumpIfNegative .ADDHLDEOppSGN        ;Signs are opposite there fore we can subtract to get difference
  95+ 6B97 FA AF 6B    >                        jp		m, .ADDHLDEOppSGN
  96+ 6B9A 78           .ADDHLDESameSigns:       ld      a,b
  97+ 6B9B B2                                   or      d
  98+ 6B9C                                      JumpIfNegative .ADDHLDESameNeg       ; optimisation so we can just do simple add if both positive
  98+ 6B9C FA A1 6B    >                        jp		m, .ADDHLDESameNeg
  99+ 6B9F 19                                   add     hl,de
 100+ 6BA0 C9                                   ret
 101+ 6BA1 7C           .ADDHLDESameNeg:         ld      a,h                         ; so if we enter here then signs are the same so we clear the 16th bit
 102+ 6BA2 E6 7F                                and     SignMask8Bit                ; we could check the value of b for optimisation
 103+ 6BA4 67                                   ld      h,a
 104+ 6BA5 7A                                   ld      a,d
 105+ 6BA6 E6 7F                                and     SignMask8Bit
 106+ 6BA8 57                                   ld      d,a
 107+ 6BA9 19                                   add     hl,de
 108+ 6BAA 3E 80                                ld      a,SignOnly8Bit
 109+ 6BAC B4                                   or      h                           ; now set bit for negative value, we won't bother with overflow for now TODO
 110+ 6BAD 67                                   ld      h,a
 111+ 6BAE C9                                   ret
 112+ 6BAF 7C           .ADDHLDEOppSGN:          ld      a,h                         ; so if we enter here then signs are the same so we clear the 16th bit                     ; here HL and DE are opposite
 113+ 6BB0 E6 7F                                and     SignMask8Bit                ; we could check the value of b for optimisation
 114+ 6BB2 67                                   ld      h,a
 115+ 6BB3 7A                                   ld      a,d
 116+ 6BB4 E6 7F                                and     SignMask8Bit
 117+ 6BB6 57                                   ld      d,a
 118+ 6BB7 B7                                   or      a
 119+ 6BB8 ED 52                                sbc     hl,de
 120+ 6BBA 38 04                                jr      c,.ADDHLDEOppInvert
 121+ 6BBC 78           .ADDHLDEOppSGNNoCarry:   ld      a,b                         ; we got here so hl > de therefore we can just take hl's previous sign bit
 122+ 6BBD B4                                   or      h
 123+ 6BBE 67                                   ld      h,a                         ; set the previou sign value
 124+ 6BBF C9                                   ret
 125+ 6BC0              .ADDHLDEOppInvert:       NegHL                                                   ; we need to flip the sign and 2'c the Hl result
 125+ 6BC0 AF          >                    xor a
 125+ 6BC1 95          >                    sub l
 125+ 6BC2 6F          >                    ld l,a
 125+ 6BC3 9F          >                    sbc a,a
 125+ 6BC4 94          >                    sub h
 125+ 6BC5 67          >                    ld h,a
 126+ 6BC6 78                                   ld      a,b
 127+ 6BC7 EE 80                                xor     SignOnly8Bit                ; flip sign bit
 128+ 6BC9 B4                                   or      h
 129+ 6BCA 67                                   ld      h,a                         ; recover sign
 130+ 6BCB C9                                   ret
 131+ 6BCC
 132+ 6BCC
 133+ 6BCC                  ; multiplication of 16-bit number and 8-bit number into a 24-bit product
 134+ 6BCC                  ;
 135+ 6BCC                  ; enter : hl = 16-bit multiplier   = x
 136+ 6BCC                  ;          e =  8-bit multiplicand = y
 137+ 6BCC                  ;
 138+ 6BCC                  ; exit  : ahl = 24-bit product
 139+ 6BCC                  ;         carry reset
 140+ 6BCC                  ;
 141+ 6BCC                  ; uses  : af, de, hl
 142+ 6BCC 54           AHLequHLmulE:           ld d,h                      ; xh
 143+ 6BCD 63                                   ld h,e                      ; yl
 144+ 6BCE ED 30                                mul de                      ; xh*yl
 145+ 6BD0 EB                                   ex de,hl
 146+ 6BD1 ED 30                                mul de                      ; yl*xl, hl = xh*yl
 147+ 6BD3
 148+ 6BD3 7A                                   ld  a,d                     ; sum products
 149+ 6BD4 85                                   add a,l
 150+ 6BD5 57                                   ld  d,a
 151+ 6BD6 EB                                   ex de,hl
 152+ 6BD7
 153+ 6BD7 7A                                   ld  a,d
 154+ 6BD8 CE 00                                adc a,0
 155+ 6BDA C9                                   ret
 156+ 6BDB
 157+ 6BDB 54           HLE0quH0mulE:           ld      d,h                 ; .
 158+ 6BDC 63                                   ld      h,e                 ; .
 159+ 6BDD ED 30                                mul     de                  ; de = xh * yl
 160+ 6BDF EB                                   ex      de,hl
 161+ 6BE0 C9                                   ret
 162+ 6BE1
 163+ 6BE1                 ; multiplication of two 16-bit numbers into a 32-bit product
 164+ 6BE1                 ;
 165+ 6BE1                 ; enter : de = 16-bit multiplicand = y
 166+ 6BE1                 ;         hl = 16-bit multiplicand = x
 167+ 6BE1                 ;
 168+ 6BE1                 ; exit  : dehl = 32-bit product
 169+ 6BE1                 ;         carry reset
 170+ 6BE1                 ;
 171+ 6BE1                 ; uses  : af, bc, de, hl
 172+ 6BE1
 173+ 6BE1
 174+ 6BE1
 175+ 6BE1 45           DEHLequDEmulHL:         ld b,l                      ; x0
 176+ 6BE2 4B                                   ld c,e                      ; y0
 177+ 6BE3 5D                                   ld e,l                      ; x0
 178+ 6BE4 6A                                   ld l,d
 179+ 6BE5 E5                                   push hl                     ; x1 y1
 180+ 6BE6 69                                   ld l,c                      ; y0
 181+ 6BE7              ; bc = x0 y0, de = y1 x0,  hl = x1 y0,  stack = x1 y1
 182+ 6BE7 ED 30                                mul de                      ; y1*x0
 183+ 6BE9 EB                                   ex de,hl
 184+ 6BEA ED 30                                mul de                      ; x1*y0
 185+ 6BEC
 186+ 6BEC AF                                   xor a                       ; zero A
 187+ 6BED 19                                   add hl,de                   ; sum cross products p2 p1
 188+ 6BEE 8F                                   adc a,a                     ; capture carry p3
 189+ 6BEF
 190+ 6BEF 59                                   ld e,c                      ; x0
 191+ 6BF0 50                                   ld d,b                      ; y0
 192+ 6BF1 ED 30                                mul de                      ; y0*x0
 193+ 6BF3
 194+ 6BF3 47                                   ld b,a                      ; carry from cross products
 195+ 6BF4 4C                                   ld c,h                      ; LSB of MSW from cross products
 196+ 6BF5
 197+ 6BF5 7A                                   ld a,d
 198+ 6BF6 85                                   add a,l
 199+ 6BF7 67                                   ld h,a
 200+ 6BF8 6B                                   ld l,e                      ; LSW in HL p1 p0
 201+ 6BF9
 202+ 6BF9 D1                                   pop de
 203+ 6BFA ED 30                                mul de                      ; x1*y1
 204+ 6BFC
 205+ 6BFC EB                                   ex de,hl
 206+ 6BFD ED 4A                                adc hl,bc
 207+ 6BFF EB                                   ex de,hl                    ; de = final MSW
 208+ 6C00
 209+ 6C00 C9                                   ret
 210+ 6C01
 211+ 6C01              ; multiplication of two 16-bit numbers into a 16-bit product
 212+ 6C01              ; enter : de = 16-bit multiplicand
 213+ 6C01              ;         hl = 16-bit multiplicand
 214+ 6C01              ; exit  : hl = 16-bit product
 215+ 6C01              ;         carry reset
 216+ 6C01              ; maths is
 217+ 6C01              ;        hl = y , de= x
 218+ 6C01              ;        hl = xhi,ylo + (yhigh * xlow)
 219+ 6C01              ;        hl = yhih & xlo + x
 220+ 6C01              ;
 221+ 6C01              ;
 222+ 6C01              ; uses  : af, bc, de, hl
 223+ 6C01 C5           mulDEbyHL:              push    bc
 224+ 6C02 7A                                   ld a,d                      ; a = xh
 225+ 6C03 54                                   ld d,h                      ; d = yh
 226+ 6C04 67                                   ld h,a                      ; h = xh
 227+ 6C05 4B                                   ld c,e                      ; c = xl
 228+ 6C06 45                                   ld b,l                      ; b = yl
 229+ 6C07 ED 30                                mul                         ; yh * yl
 230+ 6C09 EB                                   ex de,hl
 231+ 6C0A ED 30                                mul                         ; xh * yl
 232+ 6C0C 19                                   add hl,de                   ; add cross products
 233+ 6C0D 59                                   ld e,c
 234+ 6C0E 50                                   ld d,b
 235+ 6C0F ED 30                                mul                         ; yl * xl
 236+ 6C11 7D                                   ld a,l                      ; cross products lsb
 237+ 6C12 82                                   add a,d                     ; add to msb final
 238+ 6C13 67                                   ld h,a
 239+ 6C14 6B                                   ld l,e                      ; hl = final
 240+ 6C15                                      ; 83 cycles, 19 bytes
 241+ 6C15 AF                                   xor a                       ; reset carry
 242+ 6C16 C1                                   pop     bc
 243+ 6C17 C9                                   ret
 244+ 6C18
 245+ 6C18              ; multiplication of 16-bit numbers by 8-bit product
 246+ 6C18              ; enter : de = 16-bit multiplicand
 247+ 6C18              ;          l = 8-bit multiplicand
 248+ 6C18              ; exit  : hl = 16-bit product
 249+ 6C18              ;         carry reset
 250+ 6C18              ; maths is
 251+ 6C18              ;        hl = y , de= x
 252+ 6C18              ;        hl = xhi,ylo + (yhigh * xlow)
 253+ 6C18              ;        hl = yhih & xlo + x
 254+ 6C18              ;
 255+ 6C18              ;
 256+ 6C18              ; uses  : af, bc, de, hl
 257+ 6C18 C5 E5 D5     mulDEbyLSigned:         push    bc,,hl,,de
 258+ 6C1B 7A                                   ld a,d                      ; a = xh
 259+ 6C1C 16 00                                ld d,0                      ; d = yh = 0
 260+ 6C1E 67                                   ld h,a                      ; h = xh
 261+ 6C1F 4B                                   ld c,e                      ; c = xl
 262+ 6C20 45                                   ld b,l                      ; b = yl
 263+ 6C21              ;                        mul                         ; yh * xl which will always be 0
 264+ 6C21 EB                                   ex de,hl                    ; de = xh yl
 265+ 6C22 ED 30                                mul                         ; xh * yl
 266+ 6C24 EB                                   ex de,hl                    ; hl = xh * yl
 267+ 6C25              ;                        add hl,de                   ; add cross products
 268+ 6C25 59                                   ld e,c                      ; de = yl xl
 269+ 6C26 50                                   ld d,b                      ; .
 270+ 6C27 ED 30                                mul                         ; yl * xl
 271+ 6C29 7D                                   ld a,l                      ; cross products lsb
 272+ 6C2A 82                                   add a,d                     ; add to msb final
 273+ 6C2B 67                                   ld h,a
 274+ 6C2C 6B                                   ld l,e                      ; hl = final
 275+ 6C2D AF                                   xor a                       ; reset carry
 276+ 6C2E C1                                   pop     bc                  ; get de for sign
 277+ 6C2F 78                                   ld      a,b
 278+ 6C30 C1                                   pop     bc                  ; get hl for sign
 279+ 6C31 A8                                   xor     b
 280+ 6C32 E6 80                                and     $80                 ; so we now have the sign bit
 281+ 6C34 B4                                   or      h                   ; so set the sign
 282+ 6C35 67                                   ld      h,a                 ; .
 283+ 6C36 C1                                   pop     bc                  ; clear up stack
 284+ 6C37 C9                                   ret
 285+ 6C38
 286+ 6C38                  DISPLAY "TODO: TEST"
 287+ 6C38 7A           mulDEbyHLSigned:        ld  a,d                     ; de = abs de
 288+ 6C39 47                                   ld  b,a                     ;
 289+ 6C3A E6 7F                                and     $7F                 ; .
 290+ 6C3C 57                                   ld  d,a                     ; .
 291+ 6C3D 7C                                   ld  a,h                     ; hl = abs hl
 292+ 6C3E 4F                                   ld  c,a                     ; .
 293+ 6C3F E6 7F                                and     $7F                 ; .
 294+ 6C41 67                                   ld      h,a                 ; .
 295+ 6C42 79                                   ld      a,c                 ; ixl = target sign of de * hl
 296+ 6C43 AA                                   xor     d                   ;
 297+ 6C44 E6 80                                and     $80                 ;
 298+ 6C46 DD 6F                                ld      ixl,a               ;
 299+ 6C48 CD 01 6C                             call    mulDEbyHL           ; calculate ABS(DE) * ABS(HL)
 300+ 6C4B 7C                                   ld      a,h                 ; recover sign bit
 301+ 6C4C DD B5                                or      ixl
 302+ 6C4E 67                                   ld      h,a
 303+ 6C4F C9                                   ret
 304+ 6C50
 305+ 6C50              ; CHL = multiplicand D = multiplier
 306+ 6C50              ; DCHL = CHL * D
 307+ 6C50 7A           mulCHLbyDSigned:        ld      a,d                 ; get sign from d
 308+ 6C51 AC                                   xor     h                   ; xor with h to get resultant sign
 309+ 6C52 E6 80                                and     SignOnly8Bit        ; .
 310+ 6C54 FD 67                                ld      iyh,a               ; iyh = copy of sign
 311+ 6C56 79                                   ld      a,c                 ; now CHL = ABS (CHL)
 312+ 6C57 E6 7F                                and     SignMask8Bit        ; .
 313+ 6C59 4F                                   ld      c,a                 ; .
 314+ 6C5A 7A                                   ld      a,d                 ; d = ABS D
 315+ 6C5B E6 7F                                and     SignMask8Bit        ; .
 316+ 6C5D              ; At this point CHL = ABS (HLE), A = ABS(D)
 317+ 6C5D 57           .mul1:                  ld      d,a                 ; first do D * L
 318+ 6C5E 5D                                   ld      e,l                 ; .
 319+ 6C5F ED 30                                mul     de                  ; DE = L * D
 320+ 6C61 08                                   ex      af,af'              ; save multiplier
 321+ 6C62 6B                                   ld      l,e                 ; L = p0
 322+ 6C63 7A                                   ld      a,d                 ; carry byte
 323+ 6C64 08                                   ex      af,af'              ; retrieve muliplier and save carry byte along with flags
 324+ 6C65 5C           .mul2:                  ld      e,h                 ; byte 2 of multiplicand
 325+ 6C66 57                                   ld      d,a                 ; and multiplier
 326+ 6C67 ED 30                                mul     de                  ; now its D & L
 327+ 6C69 08                                   ex      af,af'              ; get back carry byte with flags
 328+ 6C6A 83           .carrybyte1:            add     a,e                 ; add low byte carry to result and retain carry too through next instructions
 329+ 6C6B 67                                   ld      h,a                 ; h = P1
 330+ 6C6C 7A                                   ld      a,d                 ; a = carry byte
 331+ 6C6D 08                                   ex      af,af'              ; save carry byte and get back multiplier with flags
 332+ 6C6E 59           .mul3:                  ld      e,c                 ; byte 3 of multiplicand
 333+ 6C6F 57                                   ld      d,a                 ;
 334+ 6C70 ED 30                                mul     de                  ;
 335+ 6C72 08                                   ex      af,af'              ; get back carry byte and carry prior to first add
 336+ 6C73 8B                                   adc     a,e                 ;
 337+ 6C74 FD B4                                or      iyh                 ; recover saved resultant sign
 338+ 6C76 4F                                   ld      c,a                 ; c byte 3. Note the value range allowed can never cause a byte 3 carry
 339+ 6C77 C9                                   ret
 340+ 6C78
 341+ 6C78              ;  CHL = 53456 D = 1E
 342+ 6C78              ;  56 * 1E = A14 L = 14 carry = 0A
 343+ 6C78              ;  34 * 1E = 618 H = 18 +A = 22 carry = 6
 344+ 6C78              ;  5  * 1E = 096 C = 96 + 6 = 9C
 345+ 6C78              ;  CHL = 9C2214
 346+ 6C78              ;mult3
 347+ 6C78              ; DELC = HLE * D, uses HL, DE, C , A , IYH
 348+ 6C78              ; HLE = multiplicand D = multiplier
 349+ 6C78              ; tested by mathstestsun.asm all passed
 350+ 6C78              ; Algorithm
 351+ 6C78              ; AC =  E * D   (save carry)         H    L    E
 352+ 6C78              ; DE =  L * D                                  D
 353+ 6C78              ;  L =  A + E + carry                         E*D (lo)
 354+ 6C78              ; DE =  H * D                             L*D+ ^ (hi)
 355+ 6C78              ;  E =  A + E + carry                H*D (lo) + carry
 356+ 6C78              ;
 357+ 6C78              ;
 358+ 6C78 7A           mulHLbyDE2sc:           ld      a,d
 359+ 6C79 AC                                   xor     h
 360+ 6C7A E6 80                                and     SignOnly8Bit
 361+ 6C7C FD 67                                ld      iyh,a               ; save sign bit for result
 362+ 6C7E 7C                                   ld      a,h
 363+ 6C7F E6 80                                and     SignOnly8Bit
 364+ 6C81 28 06                                jr      z,.HLPositive
 365+ 6C83              .HLNegative:            NegHL
 365+ 6C83 AF          >                    xor a
 365+ 6C84 95          >                    sub l
 365+ 6C85 6F          >                    ld l,a
 365+ 6C86 9F          >                    sbc a,a
 365+ 6C87 94          >                    sub h
 365+ 6C88 67          >                    ld h,a
 366+ 6C89 7A           .HLPositive:            ld      a,d
 367+ 6C8A E6 80                                and     SignOnly8Bit
 368+ 6C8C 28 06                                jr      z,.DEPositive
 369+ 6C8E              .DENegative:            NegDE
 369+ 6C8E AF          >                    xor a
 369+ 6C8F 93          >                    sub e
 369+ 6C90 5F          >                    ld e,a
 369+ 6C91 9F          >                    sbc a,a
 369+ 6C92 92          >                    sub d
 369+ 6C93 57          >                    ld d,a
 370+ 6C94 CD 01 6C     .DEPositive:            call    mulDEbyHL           ; now do calc
 371+ 6C97 FD 7C                                ld      a,iyh
 372+ 6C99 A7                                   and     a                   ; if its 0 then we are good
 373+ 6C9A C8                                   ret     z
 374+ 6C9B
 375+ 6C9B
 376+ 6C9B              ; Mulitply HLE by D leading Sign
 377+ 6C9B              ; used IY A BC
 378+ 6C9B              ; result it loaded to DELC
 379+ 6C9B 7A           mulHLEbyDSigned:        ld      a,d                 ; get sign from d
 380+ 6C9C AC                                   xor     h                   ; xor with h to get resultant sign
 381+ 6C9D E6 80                                and     SignOnly8Bit        ; .
 382+ 6C9F FD 67                                ld      iyh,a               ; iyh = copy of sign
 383+ 6CA1 7C                                   ld      a,h                 ; now HLE = ABS (HLE)
 384+ 6CA2 E6 7F                                and     SignMask8Bit        ; .
 385+ 6CA4 67                                   ld      h,a                 ; .
 386+ 6CA5 7A                                   ld      a,d                 ; d = ABS D
 387+ 6CA6 E6 7F                                and     SignMask8Bit        ; .
 388+ 6CA8 57                                   ld      d,a                 ; .
 389+ 6CA9 B7           .testEitherSideZero:    or      a
 390+ 6CAA 28 24                                jr      z,.ResultZero
 391+ 6CAC 7C                                   ld      a,h
 392+ 6CAD B5                                   or      l
 393+ 6CAE B3                                   or      e
 394+ 6CAF 28 1F                                jr      z,.ResultZero
 395+ 6CB1              ; At this point HLE = ABS (HLE), A = ABS(D)
 396+ 6CB1 42                                   ld      b,d                 ; save Quotient
 397+ 6CB2 ED 30        .mul1:                  mul     de                  ; C = E * D
 398+ 6CB4 4B                                   ld      c,e                 ; C = p0
 399+ 6CB5 FD 6A                                ld      iyl,d               ; save carry (p1)
 400+ 6CB7 5D           .mul2:                  ld      e,l                 ; L = L * D
 401+ 6CB8 50                                   ld      d,b                 ; .
 402+ 6CB9 ED 30                                mul     de                  ; .
 403+ 6CBB FD 7D                                ld      a,iyl               ; get back p1
 404+ 6CBD 83           .carrybyte1:            add     a,e                 ; L = L + E
 405+ 6CBE 6F                                   ld      l,a                 ; .
 406+ 6CBF FD 6A                                ld      iyl,d               ; save new carry byte
 407+ 6CC1 5C           .mul3:                  ld      e,h                 ; E = H * D
 408+ 6CC2 50                                   ld      d,b                 ; .
 409+ 6CC3 ED 30                                mul     de                  ; .
 410+ 6CC5 FD 7D                                ld      a,iyl
 411+ 6CC7 8B                                   adc     a,e                 ; .
 412+ 6CC8 5F                                   ld      e,a                 ; .
 413+ 6CC9 7A           .ItsNotZero:            ld      a,d                 ;
 414+ 6CCA CE 00                                adc     a,0                 ; final carry bit
 415+ 6CCC FD B4                                or      iyh                 ; bring back sign
 416+ 6CCE 57                                   ld      d,a                 ; s = sign
 417+ 6CCF C9                                   ret
 418+ 6CD0 11 00 00     .ResultZero:            ld      de,0
 419+ 6CD3                                      ZeroA
 419+ 6CD3 AF          >                        xor a
 420+ 6CD4 4F                                   ld      c,a
 421+ 6CD5 6F                                   ld      l,a
 422+ 6CD6 C9                                   ret
 423+ 6CD7
 424+ 6CD7              ;;;
 425+ 6CD7              ;;;
 426+ 6CD7              ;;;mulHLEbyDSigned:        ld      a,d                 ; get sign from d
 427+ 6CD7              ;;;                        xor     h                   ; xor with h to get resultant sign
 428+ 6CD7              ;;;                        and     SignOnly8Bit        ; .
 429+ 6CD7              ;;;                        ld      iyh,a               ; iyh = copy of sign
 430+ 6CD7              ;;;                        ld      a,h                 ; now HLE = ABS (HLE)
 431+ 6CD7              ;;;                        and     SignMask8Bit        ; .
 432+ 6CD7              ;;;                        ld      h,a                 ; .
 433+ 6CD7              ;;;                        ld      a,d                 ; d = ABS D
 434+ 6CD7              ;;;                        and     SignMask8Bit        ; .
 435+ 6CD7              ;;;                        ld      d,a                 ; .
 436+ 6CD7              ;;;.testEitherSideZero:    or      a
 437+ 6CD7              ;;;                        jr      z,.ResultZero
 438+ 6CD7              ;;;                        ld      a,h
 439+ 6CD7              ;;;                        or      l
 440+ 6CD7              ;;;                        or      e
 441+ 6CD7              ;;;                        jr      z,.ResultZero
 442+ 6CD7              ;;;; At this point HLE = ABS (HLE), A = ABS(D)
 443+ 6CD7              ;;;.mul1:                  mul     de                  ; C = E * D
 444+ 6CD7              ;;;                        ex      af,af'              ; save mulitplier
 445+ 6CD7              ;;;                        ld      c,e                 ; C = p0
 446+ 6CD7              ;;;                        ld      a,d                 ; save carry (p1)
 447+ 6CD7              ;;;                        ex      af,af'              ; .
 448+ 6CD7              ;;;.mul2:                  ld      e,l                 ; L = L * D
 449+ 6CD7              ;;;                        ld      d,a                 ; .
 450+ 6CD7              ;;;                        mul     de                  ; .
 451+ 6CD7              ;;;                        ex      af,af'              ; .
 452+ 6CD7              ;;;.carrybyte1:            add     a,e                 ; L = L + E
 453+ 6CD7              ;;;                        ld      l,a                 ; .
 454+ 6CD7              ;;;                        ld      a,d
 455+ 6CD7              ;;;                        ex      af,af'              ; save new carry byte
 456+ 6CD7              ;;;.mul3:                  ld      e,h                 ; E = H * D
 457+ 6CD7              ;;;                        ld      d,a                 ; .
 458+ 6CD7              ;;;                        mul     de                  ; .
 459+ 6CD7              ;;;                        ex      af,af'              ; .
 460+ 6CD7              ;;;                        adc     a,e                 ; .
 461+ 6CD7              ;;;                        ld      e,a                 ; .
 462+ 6CD7              ;;;.ItsNotZero:            ld      a,d                 ;
 463+ 6CD7              ;;;                        adc     a,0                 ; final carry bit
 464+ 6CD7              ;;;                        or      iyh                 ; bring back sign
 465+ 6CD7              ;;;                        ld      d,a                 ; s = sign
 466+ 6CD7              ;;;                        ret
 467+ 6CD7              ;;;.ResultZero:            ld      de,0
 468+ 6CD7              ;;;                        ZeroA
 469+ 6CD7              ;;;                        ld      c,a
 470+ 6CD7              ;;;                        ld      l,a
 471+ 6CD7              ;;;                        ret
 472+ 6CD7
 473+ 6CD7              ; multiplication of two S156-bit numbers into a 16-bit 2'd compliment product
 474+ 6CD7              ; enter : de = 16-bit multiplicand
 475+ 6CD7              ;         hl = 16-bit multiplicand
 476+ 6CD7              ; exit  : hl = 16-bit product
 477+ 6CD7              ;         carry reset
 478+ 6CD7              ;
 479+ 6CD7              ; uses  : af, bc, de, hl
 480+ 6CD7 00           mulDEbyHLSignByte       DB      0
 481+ 6CD8 AF           mulDEbyHLSgnTo2c:       xor     a
 482+ 6CD9 32 D7 6C                             ld      (mulDEbyHLSignByte),a
 483+ 6CDC 7A           .SignDE:                ld      a,d
 484+ 6CDD ED 27 80                             test    $80
 485+ 6CE0 28 08                                jr      z,.SignHL
 486+ 6CE2 E6 7F        .NegativeDE:            and     $7F
 487+ 6CE4 57                                   ld      d,a
 488+ 6CE5 3E 80                                ld      a,$80
 489+ 6CE7 32 D7 6C                             ld      (mulDEbyHLSignByte),a
 490+ 6CEA 7C           .SignHL:                ld      a,h
 491+ 6CEB ED 27 80                             test    $80
 492+ 6CEE 28 0B                                jr      z,.AbsoluteMultiply
 493+ 6CF0 E6 7F        .NegativeHL:            and     $7F
 494+ 6CF2 67                                   ld      h,a
 495+ 6CF3 3A D7 6C                             ld      a,(mulDEbyHLSignByte)
 496+ 6CF6 EE 80                                xor     $80
 497+ 6CF8 32 D7 6C                             ld      (mulDEbyHLSignByte),a
 498+ 6CFB CD 01 6C     .AbsoluteMultiply:      call    mulDEbyHL
 499+ 6CFE 3A D7 6C     .RecoverSign:           ld      a,(mulDEbyHLSignByte)
 500+ 6D01 ED 27 80                             test    $80
 501+ 6D04 C8                                   ret     z
 502+ 6D05 AF           .Negateghl: 			xor 	a
 503+ 6D06 95                                   sub 	l
 504+ 6D07 6F                                   ld 		l,a
 505+ 6D08 9F                                   sbc 	a,a
 506+ 6D09 94                                   sub 	h
 507+ 6D0A 67                                   ld 		h,a
 508+ 6D0B C9                                   ret
 509+ 6D0C
 510+ 6D0C AF           mulDESgnbyHLUnsgnTo2c:  xor     a
 511+ 6D0D 32 D7 6C                             ld      (mulDEbyHLSignByte),a
 512+ 6D10 7A           .SignDE:                ld      a,d
 513+ 6D11 ED 27 80                             test    $80
 514+ 6D14 28 08                                jr      z,.AbsoluteMultiply
 515+ 6D16 E6 7F        .NegativeDE:            and     $7F
 516+ 6D18 57                                   ld      d,a
 517+ 6D19 3E 80                                ld      a,$80
 518+ 6D1B 32 D7 6C                             ld      (mulDEbyHLSignByte),a
 519+ 6D1E CD 01 6C     .AbsoluteMultiply:      call    mulDEbyHL
 520+ 6D21 3A D7 6C     .RecoverSign:           ld      a,(mulDEbyHLSignByte)
 521+ 6D24 ED 27 80                             test    $80
 522+ 6D27 C8                                   ret     z
 523+ 6D28 AF           .Negateghl:             xor 	a
 524+ 6D29 95                                   sub 	l
 525+ 6D2A 6F                                   ld 		l,a
 526+ 6D2B 9F                                   sbc 	a,a
 527+ 6D2C 94                                   sub 	h
 528+ 6D2D 67                                   ld 		h,a
 529+ 6D2E C9                                   ret
 530+ 6D2F
 531+ 6D2F
# file closed: ../../Maths/multiply.asm
 662  6D2F                  INCLUDE "../../Maths/asm_square.asm"
# file opened: ../../Maths/asm_square.asm
   1+ 6D2F              ; "ASM_SQUA : TESTGOOD"
   2+ 6D2F              ; "AP = A^2 A = low,P = hi"
   3+ 6D2F
   4+ 6D2F              inline_squde: MACRO
   5+ 6D2F ~            			ld	e,a
   6+ 6D2F ~            			ld  d,a
   7+ 6D2F ~            			mul
   8+ 6D2F              			ENDM
   9+ 6D2F
  10+ 6D2F              inline_squa: MACRO
  11+ 6D2F ~            			ld	e,a
  12+ 6D2F ~            			ld  d,a
  13+ 6D2F ~            			mul
  14+ 6D2F ~            			ld	a,e
  15+ 6D2F              			ENDM
  16+ 6D2F
# file closed: ../../Maths/asm_square.asm
 663  6D2F                  INCLUDE "../../Maths/asm_sine.asm"
# file opened: ../../Maths/asm_sine.asm
   1+ 6D2F              ;- MACROS
   2+ 6D2F              LookupSineAMacro:       MACRO
   3+ 6D2F ~                                    ld      hl,SNE                      ; Set Q = sin(X)  = sin(CNT2 mod 32) = |sin(CNT2)|
   4+ 6D2F ~                                    add     hl, a
   5+ 6D2F ~                                    ld      a,(hl)
   6+ 6D2F                                      ENDM
   7+ 6D2F
   8+ 6D2F              ; Gets the sine of A from the lookup table into A
   9+ 6D2F              LookupSineA:            LookupSineAMacro
   9+ 6D2F 21 D8 6D    >                        ld      hl,SNE                      ; Set Q = sin(X)  = sin(CNT2 mod 32) = |sin(CNT2)|
   9+ 6D32 ED 31       >                        add     hl, a
   9+ 6D34 7E          >                        ld      a,(hl)
  10+ 6D35 C9                                   ret
  11+ 6D36
# file closed: ../../Maths/asm_sine.asm
 664  6D36                  INCLUDE "../../Maths/asm_sqrt.asm"
# file opened: ../../Maths/asm_sqrt.asm
   1+ 6D36              ; "ASM SQRT : TESTGOOD"
   2+ 6D36              ; "16-bit integer square root"
   3+ 6D36              ; "call with de = number to square root"
   4+ 6D36              ; "returns   hl = square root"
   5+ 6D36              ; "corrupts  bc, de"
   6+ 6D36              asm_sqrt:
   7+ 6D36 01 00 80     	ld bc,$8000
   8+ 6D39 61           	ld h,c
   9+ 6D3A 69           	ld l,c
  10+ 6D3B              .sqrloop:
  11+ 6D3B CB 38        	srl b
  12+ 6D3D CB 19        	rr c
  13+ 6D3F 09           	add hl,bc
  14+ 6D40 EB           	ex de,hl
  15+ 6D41 ED 52        	sbc hl,de
  16+ 6D43 38 04        	jr c,.sqrbit
  17+ 6D45 EB           	ex de,hl
  18+ 6D46 09           	add hl,bc
  19+ 6D47 18 05        	jr .sqrfi
  20+ 6D49              .sqrbit:
  21+ 6D49 19           	add hl,de
  22+ 6D4A EB           	ex de,hl
  23+ 6D4B B7           	or a
  24+ 6D4C ED 42        	sbc hl,bc
  25+ 6D4E              .sqrfi:
  26+ 6D4E CB 3C        	srl h
  27+ 6D50 CB 1D        	rr l
  28+ 6D52 CB 38        	srl b
  29+ 6D54 CB 19        	rr c
  30+ 6D56 30 E3        	jr nc,.sqrloop
  31+ 6D58 C9           	ret
  32+ 6D59
  33+ 6D59
  34+ 6D59              sqrtQR:					; Q = SQR(Qlo.Rhi) Q <~127
  35+ 6D59 3A F0 66     	ld		a,(varQ)
  36+ 6D5C 5F           	ld		e,a
  37+ 6D5D 3A F1 66     	ld		a,(varR)
  38+ 6D60 57           	ld		d,a
  39+ 6D61 CD 36 6D     	call	asm_sqrt
  40+ 6D64 7D               ld      a,l
  41+ 6D65 32 F0 66     	ld		(varQ),a
  42+ 6D68 C9           	ret
  43+ 6D69
# file closed: ../../Maths/asm_sqrt.asm
 665  6D69                  INCLUDE "../../Maths/asm_arctan.asm"
# file opened: ../../Maths/asm_arctan.asm
   1+ 6D69              ;Calculate A = arctan(P / Q)
   2+ 6D69              ; This finds the angle in the right-angled triangle where the opposite side to angle A is length P and the adjacent side to angle A has
   3+ 6D69              ; length Q, so:  tan(A) = P / Q
   4+ 6D69              ;
   5+ 6D69              ; The result in A is an integer representing the angle in radians. The routine returns values in the range 0 to 128,  (or 0 to PI radians).
   6+ 6D69 3A F0 65     ARCTAN:                 ld      a,(varP)                    ; LDA P                  \ Set T1 = P EOR Q, which will have the sign of P * Q
   7+ 6D6C 21 F0 66                             ld      hl,varQ                     ; EOR Q
   8+ 6D6F AE                                   xor     (hl)                        ; .
   9+ 6D70 32 ED 65                             ld      (varT1),a                   ; STA T1
  10+ 6D73 3A F0 66                             ld      a,(varQ)                    ; LDA Q                  \ If Q = 0, jump to AR2 to return a right angle
  11+ 6D76 A7                                   and     a                           ; BEQ AR2
  12+ 6D77 CA B9 6D                             jp      z, .AR2                     ; .
  13+ 6D7A CB 27                                sla     a                           ; ASL A                  \ Set Q = |Q| * 2 (this is a quick way of clearing the
  14+ 6D7C 32 F0 66                             ld      (varQ),a                    ; STA Q                  \ sign bit, and we don't need to shift right again as we only ever use this value in the division with |P| * 2, which we set next)
  15+ 6D7F 3A F0 65                             ld      a,(varP)                    ; LDA P                  \ Set A = |P| * 2
  16+ 6D82 CB 27                                sla     a                           ; ASL A
  17+ 6D84 32 F0 65                             ld      (varP),a
  18+ 6D87 21 F0 66                             ld      hl,varQ
  19+ 6D8A BE                                   cp      (hl)                        ; CMP Q                  \ If A >= Q, i.e. |P| > |Q|, jump to AR1 to swap P
  20+ 6D8B D2 9D 6D                             jp      nc, .AR1                    ; BCS AR1                \ and Q around, so we can still use the lookup table
  21+ 6D8E CD C5 6D                             call    ARS1                        ; JSR ARS1               \ Call ARS1 to set the following from the lookup table:  A = arctan(A / Q)  = arctan(|P / Q|)
  22+ 6D91                                      ClearCarryFlag                      ; SEC                    \ Set the C flag so the SBC instruction in AR3 will be correct, should we jump there
  22+ 6D91 B7          >                        or a
  23+ 6D92 4F           .AR4:                   ld      c,a                         ; as we have to use a we use c as a temp, we can't push af as we would loose flags on pop
  24+ 6D93 3A ED 65                             ld      a,(varT1)                   ; LDX T1                 \ If T1 is negative, i.e. P and Q have different signs,
  25+ 6D96 47                                   ld      b,a                         ; .
  26+ 6D97 A7                                   and     a                           ; BMI AR3                \ jump down to AR3 to return arctan(-|P / Q|)
  27+ 6D98 79                                   ld      a,c                         ; .                      \ we need to get a back before jump
  28+ 6D99 FA BC 6D                             jp      m, .AR3                     ; .
  29+ 6D9C C9                                   ret                                 ; RTS                    \ Otherwise P and Q have the same sign, so our result is correct and we can return from the subroutine
  30+ 6D9D              ; We want to calculate arctan(t) where |t| > 1, so we can use the calculation described in the documentation for the ACT table, i.e. 64 - arctan(1 / t)
  31+ 6D9D              ; In the 6502 verion it works with A already being P but we will fetch it
  32+ 6D9D 3A F0 66     .AR1:                   ld      a,(varQ)                    ; LDX Q                  \ Swap the values in Q and P, using the fact that we
  33+ 6DA0 47                                   ld      b,a                         ; .
  34+ 6DA1 3A F0 65                             ld      a,(varP)                    ; STA Q                  \ called AR1 with A = P
  35+ 6DA4 32 F0 66                             ld      (varQ),a                    ; .
  36+ 6DA7 78                                   ld      a,b                         ; TXA                    \ This also sets A = P (which now contains the original argument |Q|)
  37+ 6DA8 32 F0 65                             ld      (varP),a                    ; STX P                  \
  38+ 6DAB CD C5 6D                             call    ARS1                        ; JSR ARS1               \ Call ARS1 to set the following from the lookup table: A = arctan(A / Q) = arctan(|Q / P|) = arctan(1 / |P / Q|)
  39+ 6DAE 32 0C 67                             ld      (varT),a                    ; STA T                  \ Set T = 64 - T, we use B as T (its not really that)
  40+ 6DB1 47                                   ld      b,a                         ; its actually t = a, a = 64-a
  41+ 6DB2 3E 40                                ld      a,64                        ; LDA #64 What is going on here is t = result
  42+ 6DB4                                      ClearCarryFlag                      ; SBC T                            a = 64- result
  42+ 6DB4 B7          >                        or a
  43+ 6DB5 98                                   sbc     a,b                         ; .
  44+ 6DB6 C3 92 6D                             jp      .AR4                        ; BCS AR4                \ Jump to AR4 to continue the calculation (this BCS is effectively a JMP as the subtraction will never underflow, as ARS1 returns values in the range 0-31)
  45+ 6DB9              ; If we get here then Q = 0, so tan(A) = infinity and A is a right angle, or 0.25 of a circle. We allocate 255 to a full circle, so we should return 63 for a right angle
  46+ 6DB9 3E 3F        .AR2:                   ld      a,63                        ; LDA #63                \ Set A to 63, to represent a right angle
  47+ 6DBB C9                                   ret                                 ; RTS                    \ Return from the subroutine
  48+ 6DBC              ; A contains arctan(|P / Q|) but P and Q have different signs, so we need to return arctan(-|P / Q|), using the calculation described in the documentation for the ACT table, i.e. 128 - A
  49+ 6DBC 32 0C 67     .AR3:                   ld      (varT),a
  50+ 6DBF 47                                   ld      b,a                         ; STA T                  \ Set A = 128 - A, we use b as T
  51+ 6DC0 3E 80                                ld      a,128                       ; LDA #128               \
  52+ 6DC2                                      ClearCarryFlag                      ; SBC T                  \ The subtraction will work because we did a SEC before calling AR3
  52+ 6DC2 B7          >                        or a
  53+ 6DC3 98                                   sbc     a,b
  54+ 6DC4 C9                                   ret                                 ; RTS                    \ Return from the subroutine
  55+ 6DC5              ; This routine fetches arctan(A / Q) from the ACT table, so A will be set to an integer in the range 0 to 31 that represents an angle from 0 to 45 degrees (or 0 to \ PI / 4 radians)
  56+ 6DC5 CD C9 79     ARS1:                   call    LL28Amul256DivQ_6502        ; JSR LL28               \ Call LL28 to calculate: R = 256 * A / Q
  57+ 6DC8 3A F1 66                             ld      a,(varR)                    ; LDA R                  \ Set X = R / 8
  58+ 6DCB CB 3F                                srl     a                           ; LSR A                  \       = 32 * A / Q
  59+ 6DCD CB 3F                                srl     a                           ; LSR A                  \
  60+ 6DCF CB 3F                                srl     a                           ; LSR A                  \ so X has the value t * 32 where t = A / Q, which is
  61+ 6DD1 21 F8 6D                             ld      hl,ACT                      ; TAX                    \ what we need to look up values in the ACT table
  62+ 6DD4 ED 31                                add     hl,a                        ; LDA ACT,X              \ Fetch ACT+X from the ACT table into A, so now:
  63+ 6DD6 7E                                   ld      a,(hl)                      ;                        \   A = value in ACT + X = value in ACT + (32 * A / Q)= arctan(A / Q)
  64+ 6DD7 C9                                   ret                                 ; RTS                    \ Return from the subroutine
  65+ 6DD8
  66+ 6DD8              ;;;arctan:										; .ARCTAN	\ -> &2A3C  \ A=TAN-1(P/Q) \ A=arctan (P/Q)  called from block E
  67+ 6DD8              ;;;		ld		a,(varP)					; a = var P
  68+ 6DD8              ;;;		ld		hl,varQ
  69+ 6DD8              ;;;		xor		(hl)						; a = var p XOR varQ
  70+ 6DD8              ;;;		ld		a,(varT1)					; \ T1	 \ quadrant info
  71+ 6DD8              ;;;		ld		c,a							; c = copy of T1
  72+ 6DD8              ;;;		ld		a,(hl)						; Q
  73+ 6DD8              ;;;		cp		0
  74+ 6DD8              ;;;		jr		z,.AR2						;  Q=0 so set angle to 63, pi/2
  75+ 6DD8              ;;;		ld		(varQ),a					; Q move to reg B?
  76+ 6DD8              ;;;		ld		d,a							; copy to reg d
  77+ 6DD8              ;;;		sla		a							; drop sign
  78+ 6DD8              ;;;		ld		a,(varP)					; P
  79+ 6DD8              ;;;		ld		e,a							; copy to reg e
  80+ 6DD8              ;;;		sla		a							; drop sign
  81+ 6DD8              ;;;		cp		d							; compare with b (unsigned varQ * 2)
  82+ 6DD8              ;;;		jr		nc, .ars1					; if q >  p then adjust  swop A and Q as A >= Q
  83+ 6DD8              ;;;		call	ars1						; \ ARS1 \ get Angle for A*32/Q from table.
  84+ 6DD8              ;;;		scf									; set carry flag
  85+ 6DD8              ;;;.ar4:										; sub o.k
  86+ 6DD8              ;;;		bit 	7,c							; is T1 (also in c) negative?
  87+ 6DD8              ;;;		jr		nz,.ar3						;  -ve quadrant
  88+ 6DD8              ;;;		ret
  89+ 6DD8              ;;;.ar1:										; swop A and Q entering here d = q and e = P
  90+ 6DD8              ;;;		ld		a,d							; a = varQ
  91+ 6DD8              ;;;		ld		d,e							; varQ = varP
  92+ 6DD8              ;;;		ld		e,a							; swap D and E around
  93+ 6DD8              ;;;		ld		(varP),a					; write to actual variables
  94+ 6DD8              ;;;		ld		a,d
  95+ 6DD8              ;;;		ld		(varQ),a					; write to actual variables
  96+ 6DD8              ;;;		call	.ars1
  97+ 6DD8              ;;;		ld		(varT),b
  98+ 6DD8              ;;;		ld		b,a							; B = T = angle
  99+ 6DD8              ;;;		ld		a,64						; next range of angle, pi/4 to pi/2
 100+ 6DD8              ;;;		sub		a,b							; a = 64 - T (or b)
 101+ 6DD8              ;;;		jr		nc,.ar4						;  sub o.k
 102+ 6DD8              ;;;.ar2:										; .AR2	\ set angle to 90 degrees
 103+ 6DD8              ;;;		ld 		a,&3F						;  #63
 104+ 6DD8              ;;;		ret
 105+ 6DD8              ;;;.ar3:										;.AR3	\ -ve quadrant
 106+ 6DD8              ;;;		ld		b,a							; b = T	= \ angle
 107+ 6DD8              ;;;		ld		a,ConstPi					; a = Pi
 108+ 6DD8              ;;;		sub		b,a							; A = 128-T, so now covering range pi/2 to pi correctly
 109+ 6DD8              ;;;		ret
 110+ 6DD8              ;;;.ars1:										; .ARS1	\ -> &2A75  \ get Angle for A*32/Q from table.
 111+ 6DD8              ;;;		call	RequAmul256divQ				;  LL28 \ BFRDIV R=A*256/Q
 112+ 6DD8              ;;;		ld		a,(regA)
 113+ 6DD8              ;;;		srl		a
 114+ 6DD8              ;;;		srl		a
 115+ 6DD8              ;;;		srl		a							;  31 max.
 116+ 6DD8              ;;;		ld		hl, ArcTanTable				; root of index into table at end of words data
 117+ 6DD8              ;;;		add		hl,a						; now at real data
 118+ 6DD8              ;;;		ld		a,(hl)						; a =  ACT[a]
 119+ 6DD8              ;;;.arsr:										; rts used by laser lines below (will not in later code)
 120+ 6DD8              ;;;		ret
 121+ 6DD8
 122+ 6DD8
 123+ 6DD8
# file closed: ../../Maths/asm_arctan.asm
 666  6DD8                  INCLUDE "../../Maths/SineTable.asm"
# file opened: ../../Maths/SineTable.asm
   1+ 6DD8              ;; PRINT "SIN TABLE"
   2+ 6DD8              ;; FOR I% =  0 TO  31
   3+ 6DD8              ;; N = ABS(SIN((I%/64)*2*PI))
   4+ 6DD8              ;; IF N >= 1 THEN B% = 255  ELSE B% = INT(256 * N + 0.5)
   5+ 6DD8              ;; PRINT B%
   6+ 6DD8              ;; NEXT I%
   7+ 6DD8
   8+ 6DD8
   9+ 6DD8 00 19 32 4A  SNE:            DB 000, 025, 050, 074, 098, 121, 142, 162
   9+ 6DDC 62 79 8E A2
  10+ 6DE0 B5 C6 D5 E2                  DB 181, 198, 213, 226, 237, 245, 251, 255
  10+ 6DE4 ED F5 FB FF
  11+ 6DE8 FF FF FB F5                  DB 255, 255, 251, 245, 237, 226, 213, 198
  11+ 6DEC ED E2 D5 C6
  12+ 6DF0 B5 A2 8E 79                  DB 181, 162, 142, 121, 098, 074, 050, 025
  12+ 6DF4 62 4A 32 19
# file closed: ../../Maths/SineTable.asm
 667  6DF8                  INCLUDE "../../Maths/ArcTanTable.asm"
# file opened: ../../Maths/ArcTanTable.asm
   1+ 6DF8              ;PRINT "ARCTAN TABLE"
   2+ 6DF8              ;FOR I% = 0 TO 31
   3+ 6DF8              ;    PRINT INT((128/PI) * ATN(I%/32)+0.5)
   4+ 6DF8              ;NEXT I%
   5+ 6DF8
   6+ 6DF8 00 01 03 04  ACT:            DB 000, 001, 003, 004, 005, 006, 008, 009
   6+ 6DFC 05 06 08 09
   7+ 6E00 0A 0B 0C 0D                  DB 010, 011, 012, 013, 015, 016, 017, 018
   7+ 6E04 0F 10 11 12
   8+ 6E08 13 14 15 16                  DB 019, 020, 021, 022, 023, 024, 025, 025
   8+ 6E0C 17 18 19 19
   9+ 6E10 1A 1B 1C 1D                  DB 026, 027, 028, 029, 030, 031, 031, 031
   9+ 6E14 1E 1F 1F 1F
  10+ 6E18
