  45++C7D4 ED 27 80                             test    $80                         ; i.e  screen height < y1)
  46++C7D7 20 21                                jr      nz,.LL83
  47++C7D9              ; If we get here, (x1, y1) is on-screen
  48++C7D9 FD 7C                                ld      a,iyh                       ; iyh = xx13 at this point if  XX13 <> 0 goto LL108                                                        -- X1Y1 on screen, if we flagged X2Y2 off screen goto LL108
  49++C7DB FE 00                                cp      0
  50++C7DD 20 15                                jr      nz, .LL108
  51++C7DF              ; Finished clipping exit point ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  52++C7DF 79           .ClipDone:              ld      a,c                         ; LL146 (Clip Done)               Y1 = y1 lo, x2 = x2 lo, x1 = x1 lo y1 = y1 lo                                   -- Nothing off screen
  53++C7E0 32 A7 C0                             ld      (UBnkNewY1),a
  54++C7E3 DD 7D                                ld      a,ixl
  55++C7E5 32 A9 C0                             ld      (UBnkNewY2),a
  56++C7E8 7D                                   ld      a,l
  57++C7E9 32 A6 C0                             ld      (UBnkNewX1),a
  58++C7EC 7B                                   ld      a,e
  59++C7ED 32 A8 C0                             ld      (UBnkNewX2),a
  60++C7F0                                      ClearCarryFlag                      ; carry is clear so valid to plot is in XX15(0to3)
  60++C7F0 B7          >                        or a
  61++C7F1 C9                                   ret                                 ; 2nd pro different, it swops based on swop flag around here.
  62++C7F2              ; Finished out of bounds exit point -----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  63++C7F2              .PointsOutofBounds:     SetCarryFlag                        ; LL109 (ClipFailed) carry flag set as not visible
  63++C7F2 37          >                        scf
  64++C7F3 C9                                   ret
  65++C7F4 FD 7C        .LL108:                 ld      a,iyh
  66++C7F6 B7                                   or      a
  67++C7F7 1F                                   rra
  68++C7F8 FD 67                                ld      iyh,a                       ; (X2Y2 Off Screen)         XX13 = 95 (i.e. divide it by 2)                                                 -- X1Y1 on screen X2Y2 off screen
  69++C7FA FD 7C        .LL83:                  ld      a,iyh                       ; (Line On screen Test)      if XX13 < 128 then only 1 point is on screen so goto LL115                      -- We only need to deal with X2Y2
  70++C7FC ED 27 80                             test    $80                         ;
  71++C7FF 28 28                                jr      z, .LL115                   ;
  72++C801              ;                       Check for X1 and X2 negative
  73++C801 7C                                   ld      a,h                         ; If both x1_hi and x2_hi have bit 7 set, jump to LL109  to return from the subroutine with the C flag set, as the entire line is above the top of the screen
  74++C802 A2                                   and     d
  75++C803                                      JumpIfNegative  .PointsOutofBounds
  75++C803 FA F2 C7    >                        jp		m, .PointsOutofBounds
  76++C806              ;                       Check for Y1 and Y2 negative
  77++C806 78                                   ld      a,b                         ; If both y1_hi and y2_hi have bit 7 set, jump to LL109  to return from the subroutine with the C flag set, as the entire line is above the top of the screen
  78++C807 DD A4                                and     ixh
  79++C809                                      JumpIfNegative  .PointsOutofBounds
  79++C809 FA F2 C7    >                        jp		m, .PointsOutofBounds
  80++C80C              ;                       Check for X1 and X2 both > 255
  81++C80C 7C                                   ld      a,h                         ; If neither (x1_hi - 1) or (x2_hi - 1) have bit 7 set, jump to LL109 to return from the subroutine with the C  flag set, as the line doesn't fit on-screen
  82++C80D 3D                                   dec     a
  83++C80E FD 6F                                ld      iyl,a                       ; using iyl as XX12+2 var
  84++C810 7A                                   ld      a,d                         ; a = x2 hi
  85++C811 3D                                   dec     a
  86++C812 FD B5                                or      iyl                         ; (x2 hi -1 ) or (x1 hi -1)
  87++C814                                      JumpIfPositive .PointsOutofBounds   ; if both x1 and x2hi were > 0 then subtracting 1 would result in 0..254 so either being negative means it was 0 before
  87++C814 F2 F2 C7    >                        jp		p, .PointsOutofBounds
  88++C817              ; by here we have eliminated -ve Y1 bounds so can just test for positive high and bit 7 of lo
  89++C817 DD 7C                                ld      a,ixh
  90++C819 3D                                   dec     a
  91++C81A FD 6F                                ld      iyl,a
  92++C81C 78                                   ld      a,b
  93++C81D 3D                                   dec     a
  94++C81E FD B5                                or      iyl
  95++C820                                      JumpIfPositive .PointsOutofBounds   ; if both x1 and x2hi were > 0 then subtracting 1 would result in 0..254 so either being negative means it was 0 before
  95++C820 F2 F2 C7    >                        jp		p, .PointsOutofBounds
  96++C823 79                                   ld      a,c
  97++C824 DD A5                                and     ixl
  98++C826                                      JumpIfNegative .PointsOutofBounds   ; really if both are > 127
  98++C826 FA F2 C7    >                        jp		m, .PointsOutofBounds
  99++C829              ; Clip line: calulate the line's gradient
 100++C829              ; here as an optimisation we make sure X1 is always < X2  later on
 101++C829              .LL115:                 ClearCarryFlag
 101++C829 B7          >                        or a
 102++C82A E5 D5        .CalcDX:                push    hl,,de
 103++C82C EB                                   ex      hl,de                       ; so hl is x2 and de = x1
 104++C82D ED 52                                sbc     hl,de
 105++C82F 22 97 C7                             ld      (clipDx),hl
 106++C832 7C                                   ld      a,h
 107++C833 32 99 C7                             ld      (clipDxHighNonABS),a
 108++C836              .CalcDy:                ClearCarryFlag
 108++C836 B7          >                        or a
 109++C837 DD E5 E1                             ld      hl,ix
 110++C83A ED 42                                sbc     hl,bc
 111++C83C 54 5D                                ld      de,hl           ;;OPTIMISATION 6/11/21
 112++C83E 22 9A C7                             ld      (clipDy),hl     ;OPTIMISATION 6/11/21 commented out
 113++C841 7C           .CalcQuadrant:          ld      a,h
 114++C842 32 9B C7                             ld      (clipDyHigh),a              ; so A = sign of deltay in effect
 115++C845              ; So we now have delta_x in XX12(3 2), delta_y in XX12(5 4)  where the delta is (x1, y1) - (x2, y2))
 116++C845 21 98 C7                             ld      hl,clipDxHigh
 117++C848 AE                                   xor     (hl)                        ; now a = sign dx xor sign dy
 118++C849 32 F2 66                             ld      (varS),a                    ; DEBGU putting it in var S too for now
 119++C84C 32 9D C7                             ld      (clipDxySign),a
 120++C84F 3A 9B C7     .AbsDy:                 ld      a,(clipDyHigh)
 121++C852 ED 27 80                             test    $80
 122++C855 28 0E                                jr      z,.LL110                    ; If delta_y_hi is positive, jump down to LL110 to skip the following
 123++C857 ED 5B 9A C7                          ld      de,(clipDy)                 ;OPTIMISATION 6/11/21 commented out
 124++C85B                                      macronegate16de                     ; Otherwise flip the sign of delta_y to make it  positive, starting with the low bytes
 124++C85B AF          >					xor 	a
 124++C85C 93          >                    sub 	e
 124++C85D 5F          >                    ld 		e,a
 124++C85E 9F          >                    sbc 	a,a
 124++C85F 92          >                    sub 	d
 124++C860 57          >                    ld 		d,a
 125++C861 ED 53 9A C7                          ld      (clipDy),de                 ;OPTIMISATION 6/11/21 commented out
 126++C865 2A 97 C7     .LL110:                 ld      hl,(clipDx)
 127++C868 3A 98 C7                             ld      a,(clipDxHigh)
 128++C86B ED 27 80                             test    $80                         ; is it a negative X
 129++C86E 28 06                                jr      z,.LL111                    ; If delta_x_hi is positive, jump down to LL110 to skip the following
 130++C870                                      ;ld      hl,(clipDx)                 ;OPTIMISATION 6/11/21 commented out
 131++C870                                      macronegate16hl                     ; Otherwise flip the sign of delta_y to make it  positive, starting with the low bytes
 131++C870 AF          >					xor 	a
 131++C871 95          >					sub 	l
 131++C872 6F          >					ld 		l,a
 131++C873 9F          >					sbc 	a,a
 131++C874 94          >					sub 	h
 131++C875 67          >					ld 		h,a
 132++C876              .LL111:
 133++C876 7C           .ScaleLoop:             ld      a,h                         ; At this point DX and DY are ABS values
 134++C877 B2                                   or      d
 135++C878 28 0A                                jr      z,.CalculateDelta
 136++C87A                                      ShiftDERight1
 136++C87A CB 3A       >			   srl d
 136++C87C CB 1B       >			   rr  e
 137++C87E                                      ShiftHLRight1
 137++C87E CB 3C       >			   srl h
 137++C880 CB 1D       >			   rr  l
 138++C882 18 F2                                jr      .ScaleLoop                  ; scaled down Dx and Dy to 8 bit, Dy may have been negative
 139++C884              .CalculateDelta:
 140++C884              ; By now, the high bytes of both |delta_x| and |delta_y| are zero We know that h and d are both = 0 as that's what we tested with a BEQ
 141++C884 AF           .LL113:                 xor     a
 142++C885 32 0C 67                             ld      (varT),a                    ; t = 0
 143++C888 7D                                   ld      a,l                         ; If delta_x_lo < delta_y_lo, so our line is more vertical than horizontal, jump to LL114
 144++C889                                      JumpIfALTNusng  e, .LL114           ;
 144++C889 BB          >                        cp      e
 144++C88A DA 9A C8    >                        jp		c, .LL114
 145++C88D              ; Here Dx >= Dy sp calculate Delta Y / delta X
 146++C88D 32 F0 66     .DxGTEDy:               ld      (varQ),a                    ; Set Q = delta_x_lo
 147++C890 57                                   ld      d,a                         ; d = also Q for calc
 148++C891 7B                                   ld      a,e                         ; Set A = delta_y_lo
 149++C892 CD CF 6F                             call    AEquAmul256DivD; LL28Amul256DivD             ; Call LL28 to calculate:  R (actually a reg) = 256 * A / Q   = 256 * delta_y_lo / delta_x_lo
 150++C895 32 F1 66                             ld      (varR),a                    ;
 151++C898 18 10                                jr      .LL116                      ; Jump to LL116, as we now have the line's gradient in R
 152++C89A              ; Here Delta Y > Delta X so calulate delta X / delta Y
 153++C89A 7B           .LL114:                 ld      a,e                         ; Set Q = delta_y_lo
 154++C89B 57                                   ld      d,a
 155++C89C 32 F0 66                             ld      (varQ),a
 156++C89F 7D                                   ld      a,l                         ; Set A = delta_x_lo
 157++C8A0 CD CF 6F                             call    AEquAmul256DivD; LL28Amul256DivD             ; Call LL28 to calculate: R = 256 * A / Q  = 256 * delta_x_lo / delta_y_lo
 158++C8A3 32 F1 66                             ld      (varR),a                    ;
 159++C8A6 21 0C 67                             ld      hl,varT                     ; T was set to 0 above, so this sets T = &FF
 160++C8A9 35                                   dec     (hl)
 161++C8AA D1           .LL116:                 pop     de                          ; get back X2
 162++C8AB E1                                   pop     hl                          ; get back X1 into hl,
 163++C8AC 3A F1 66                             ld      a,(varR)                    ; Store the gradient in XX12+2 this can be optimised later
 164++C8AF 32 9C C7                             ld      (clipGradient),a
 165++C8B2 FD 6F                                ld      iyl,a
 166++C8B4 3A F2 66                             ld      a,(varS)
 167++C8B7 32 9D C7                             ld      (clipDxySign),a             ;  Store the type of slope in XX12+3, bit 7 clear means ?Not needed as clipDxySign is used for varS earlier?
 168++C8BA                                                                          ; top left to bottom right, bit 7 set means top right to bottom left **CODE IS WRONG HERE A TEST IS BL to TR
 169++C8BA FD 7C                                ld      a,iyh                       ; iyh was XX13 from earlier
 170++C8BC FE 00                                cp      0                           ; If XX13 = 0, skip the following instruction
 171++C8BE 28 05                                jr      z,.LL138                    ;
 172++C8C0 ED 27 80                             test    $80                         ; If XX13 is positive, it must be 95. This means (x1, y1) is on-screen but (x2, y2) isn't, so we jump to LLX117 to swap the (x1, y1) and (x2, y2)
 173++C8C3 28 13                                jr      z,.LLX117                   ; coordinates around before doing the actual clipping, because we need to clip (x2, y2) but the clipping routine at LL118 only clips (x1, y1)
 174++C8C5              ; If we get here, XX13 = 0 or 191, so (x1, y1) is off-screen and needs clipping
 175++C8C5 CD EC C8     .LL138                  call    ClipPointHLBC               ; Call LL118 to move (x1, y1) along the line onto the screen, i.e. clip the line at the (x1, y1) end
 176++C8C8 FD 7C                                ld      a,iyh                       ; If XX13 = 0, i.e. (x2, y2) is on-screen, jump down to LL124 to return with a successfully clipped line
 177++C8CA ED 27 80                             test    $80
 178++C8CD 28 1A                                jr      z,.LL124
 179++C8CF              ; If we get here, XX13 = 191 (both coordinates are off-screen)
 180++C8CF 7C           .LL117:                 ld      a,h                         ; If either of x1_hi or y1_hi are non-zero, jump to
 181++C8D0 B0                                   or      b                           ; LL137 to return from the subroutine with the C flag
 182++C8D1 C2 F2 C7                             jp      nz, .PointsOutofBounds      ; set, as the line doesn't fit on-screen
 183++C8D4 B1                                   or      c                           ; if x1 and y1 hi are both zero test bit 8 or Y1 to see if its > 128
 184++C8D5 FA F2 C7                             jp      m, .PointsOutofBounds       ; set, as the line doesn't fit on-screen
 185++C8D8              ; If we get here, XX13 = 95 or 191, and in both cases (x2, y2) is off-screen, so we now need to swap the (x1, y1) and (x2, y2) coordinates around before doing
 186++C8D8              ; the actual clipping, because we need to clip (x2, y2) but the clipping routine at LL118 only clips (x1, y1)
 187++C8D8 EB           .LLX117:                ex      de,hl                       ;  swap X1 and X2
 188++C8D9 DD E5                                push    ix                          ;  swap Y1 and Y2
 189++C8DB C5                                   push    bc
 190++C8DC DD E1                                pop     ix
 191++C8DE C1                                   pop     bc
 192++C8DF CD EC C8                             call    ClipPointHLBC               ;  Call LL118 to move (x1, y1) along the line onto the screen, i.e. clip the line at the (x1, y1) end
 193++C8E2 3A A0 C7                             ld      a,(SWAP)
 194++C8E5 3D                                   dec     a
 195++C8E6 32 A0 C7                             ld      (SWAP),a                    ; Set SWAP = &FF to indicate that we just clipped the line at the (x2, y2) end by swapping the coordinates (the DEC does this as we set SWAP to 0 at the start of this subroutine)
 196++C8E9 C3 DF C7     .LL124:                 jp      .ClipDone                    ; now put points in place
 197++C8EC              ; Move a point along a line until it is on-screen point is held in HL(X) BC(Y) LL118
 198++C8EC              ; iyh still holds XX13 iyl still holds gradient
 199++C8EC 7C           ClipPointHLBC:          ld      a,h                         ; If x1_hi is positive, jump down to LL119 to skip the following
 200++C8ED ED 27 80                             test    $80
 201++C8F0 28 17                                jr      z,.LL119
 202++C8F2 32 F2 66     .X1isNegative:          ld      (varS),a                    ;  Otherwise x1_hi is negative, i.e. off the left of the screen, so set S = x1_hi
 203++C8F5 E5 D5 C5                             push    hl,,de,,bc
 204++C8F8 CD 6E C9                             call    LL120                       ;  Call LL120 to calculate:   (Y X) = (S x1_lo) * XX12+2      if T = 0   = x1 * gradient
 205++C8FB                                                                          ;                             (Y X) = (S x1_lo) / XX12+2      if T <> 0  = x1 / gradient
 206++C8FB                                                                          ;  with the sign of (Y X) set to the opposite of the line's direction of slope
 207++C8FB C1 D1 E1                             pop    hl,,de,,bc                   ;  get coordinates back
 208++C8FE 2A A1 C7                             ld      hl,(varYX)
 209++C901 09                                   add     hl,bc                       ; y1 = y1 + varYX
 210++C902 44 4D                                ld      bc,hl
 211++C904 21 00 00                             ld      hl,0                        ; Set x1 = 0
 212++C907 18 1A                                jr      .LL134                      ; in BBC is set x to 0 to force jump, we will just jump
 213++C909 FE 00        .LL119:                 cp      0
 214++C90B 28 16                                jr      z,.LL134                    ;  If x1_hi = 0 then jump down to LL134 to skip the following, as the x-coordinate is already on-screen (as 0 <= (x_hi x_lo) <= 255)
 215++C90D 3D                                   dec     a
 216++C90E 32 F2 66                             ld      (varS),a                    ;  Otherwise x1_hi is positive, i.e. x1 >= 256 and off the right side of the screen, so set S = x1_hi - 1
 217++C911 E5 D5 C5                             push    hl,,de,,bc
 218++C914 CD 6E C9                             call    LL120                      ;  Call LL120 to calculate: (Y X) = (S x1_lo) * XX12+2      if T = 0  = (x1 - 256) * gradient
 219++C917                                                                          ;                           (Y X) = (S x1_lo) / XX12+2      if T <> 0 = (x1 - 256) / gradient
 220++C917                                                                          ;  with the sign of (Y X) set to the opposite of theline's direction of slope
 221++C917 C1 D1 E1                             pop     hl,,de,,bc
 222++C91A 2A A1 C7                             ld      hl,(varYX)
 223++C91D 09                                   add     hl,bc                        ;OPTIMISATION 6/11/21 simplfied post debug
 224++C91E 44 4D                                ld      bc,hl                        ;OPTIMISATION 6/11/21 simplfied post debug
 225++C920 21 FF 00                             ld      hl,255                      ; Set x1 = 255
 226++C923              ; We have moved the point so the x-coordinate is on screen (i.e. in the range 0-255), so now for they-coordinate
 227++C923 78           .LL134:                 ld      a,b                         ; If y1_hi is positive, jump down to LL135  to skip the following
 228++C924 ED 27 80                             test    $80                         ;
 229++C927 28 1A                                jr      z,.LL135                    ;
 230++C929 32 F2 66                             ld      (varS),a                    ; Otherwise y1_hi is negative, i.e. off the top of the screen, so set S = y1_hi
 231++C92C 79                                   ld      a,c                         ; Set R = y1_lo
 232++C92D 32 F1 66                             ld      (varR),a                    ;
 233++C930 E5 D5 C5                             push    hl,,de,,bc
 234++C933 CD CF C9                             call    LL123                       ;  Call LL123 to calculate: (Y X) = (S R) / XX12+2      if T = 0  = y1 / gradient
 235++C936                                                                          ;                           (Y X) = (S R) * XX12+2      if T <> 0 = y1 * gradient
 236++C936                                                                          ;  with the sign of (Y X) set to the opposite of the line's direction of slope
 237++C936 C1 D1 E1                             pop     hl,,de,,bc
 238++C939 D5                                   push    de
 239++C93A EB                                   ex      hl,de                       ; de = x1
 240++C93B 2A A1 C7                             ld      hl,(varYX)                  ; hl = varYX
 241++C93E 19                                   add     hl,de                       ; we don't need to swap back as its an add, Set x1 = x1 + (Y X)
 242++C93F D1                                   pop     de                          ; de = x2 again
 243++C940 01 00 00                             ld      bc,0                        ; Set y1 = 0
 244++C943 79           .LL135:                 ld      a,c                         ; if bc < 128 then no work to do
 245++C944 E6 80                                and     $80
 246++C946 B0                                   or      b                           ; here we see if c bit 8 is set or anything in b as we know if its 0 this would mean there is no need to clip
 247++C947 C8                                   ret     z
 248++C948 E5                                   push    hl
 249++C949 60 69                                ld      hl,bc
 250++C94B 01 80 00                             ld      bc,128
 251++C94E B7                                   or      a
 252++C94F ED 42                                sbc     hl,bc                       ; hl =  (S R) = (y1_hi y1_lo) - 128
 253++C951 22 F1 66                             ld      (varRS), hl                 ; and now RS (or SR)
 254++C954 7C                                   ld      a,h
 255++C955 E1                                   pop     hl
 256++C956 ED 27 80                             test    $80                         ; If the subtraction underflowed, i.e. if y1 < 192, then y1 is already on-screen, so jump to LL136 to return from the subroutine, as we are done
 257++C959 C0                                   ret     nz
 258++C95A              ; If we get here then y1 >= 192, i.e. off the bottom of the screen
 259++C95A E5 D5 C5     .LL139:                 push    hl,,de,,bc
 260++C95D CD CF C9                             call    LL123                       ;  Call LL123 to calculate: (Y X) = (S R) / XX12+2      if T = 0  = y1 / gradient
 261++C960                                                                          ;                           (Y X) = (S R) * XX12+2      if T <> 0 = y1 * gradient
 262++C960                                                                          ;  with the sign of (Y X) set to the opposite of the line's direction of slope
 263++C960 C1 D1 E1                             pop     hl,,de,,bc
 264++C963 D5                                   push    de
 265++C964 EB                                   ex      hl,de
 266++C965 2A A1 C7                             ld      hl,(varYX)
 267++C968 19                                   add     hl,de                       ; we don't need to swap back as its an add, Set x1 = x1 + (Y X)
 268++C969 01 7F 00                             ld      bc,127                      ; set bc to 127 bottom of screen
 269++C96C D1                                   pop     de
 270++C96D C9           .LL136:                 ret                                 ;  Return from the subroutine
 271++C96E                      ENDIF
 272++C96E
 273++C96E              ; Calculate the following:   * If T = 0  (more vertical than horizontal), (Y X) = (S x1_lo) * XX12+2
 274++C96E              ;                            * If T <> 0 (more horizontal than vertical), (Y X) = (S x1_lo) / XX12+2
 275++C96E              ;                              giving (Y X) the opposite sign to the slope direction in XX12+3.
 276++C96E              ; Other entry points        LL122                Calculate (Y X) = (S R) * Q and set the sign to the opposite of the top byte on the stack
 277++C96E 7D           LL120:                  ld      a,l                          ; Set R = x1_lo
 278++C96F 32 F1 66                             ld      (varR),a
 279++C972 CD 2C CA                             call    LL129                        ;  Call LL129 to do the following:  Q = XX12+2   = line gradient  A = S EOR XX12+3 = S EOR slope direction (S R) = |S R| So A contains the sign of S * slope direction
 280++C975 F5                                   push    af                           ;  Store A on the stack so we can use it later
 281++C976 C5                                   push    bc
 282++C977 47                                   ld      b,a
 283++C978 3A 0C 67                             ld      a,(varT)                     ; instead : (Y X) = (S R ) / Q
 284++C97B FE 00                                cp      0
 285++C97D 78                                   ld      a,b
 286++C97E C1                                   pop     bc                           ; we can't use af as that would disrupt the flags
 287++C97F C2 96 C9                             jp      nz, .LL121
 288++C982              ; The following calculates:  (Y X) = (S R) * Q using the same shift-and-add algorithm that's documented in MULT1
 289++C982 3A 9C C7     .LL122:                  ld      a,(clipGradient)
 290++C985 32 F0 66                             ld      (varQ),a; optimise
 291++C988 CD 10 6B                             call    HLequSRmulQdiv256
 292++C98B 22 A1 C7                             ld      (varYX),hl
 293++C98E F1                                   pop     af
 294++C98F ED 27 80                             test    $80
 295++C992 CA C2 C9                             jp      z,.LL133
 296++C995 C9                                   ret
 297++C996 11 FE FF     .LL121:                  ld      de,$FFFE                    ; set XY to &FFFE at start, de holds XY
 298++C999 2A F1 66                             ld      hl,(varRS)                  ; hl = RS
 299++C99C 3A F0 66                             ld      a,(varQ)
 300++C99F 47                                   ld      b,a                         ; b = q
 301++C9A0              .LL130:                 ShiftHLLeft1                        ; RS *= 2
 301++C9A0 CB 25       >			   sla l
 301++C9A2 CB 14       >			   rl  h
 302++C9A4 7C                                   ld      a,h
 303++C9A5 38 04                                jr      c,.LL131                    ; if S overflowed skip Q test and do subtractions
 304++C9A7                                      JumpIfALTNusng b, .LL132            ; if S <  Q = 256/gradient skip subtractions
 304++C9A7 B8          >                        cp      b
 304++C9A8 DA B3 C9    >                        jp		c, .LL132
 305++C9AB 3F           .LL131:                 ccf                                 ; compliment carry
 306++C9AC 98                                   sbc     a,b                         ; q
 307++C9AD 67                                   ld      h,a                         ; h (s)
 308++C9AE 7D                                   ld      a,l                         ; r
 309++C9AF DE 00                                sbc     a,0                         ; 0 - so in effect SR - Q*256
 310++C9B1 37                                   scf                                 ; set carry for next rolls
 311++C9B2 3F                                   ccf
 312++C9B3              .LL132:                 RollDELeft1                         ; Rotate de bits left
 312++C9B3 CB 13       >               rl  e
 312++C9B5 CB 12       >               rl  d
 313++C9B7 38 E7                                jr      c,.LL130                    ;
 314++C9B9 ED 53 A1 C7                          ld      (varYX),de
 315++C9BD F1                                   pop     af              ; get back sign
 316++C9BE ED 27 80                             test    $80
 317++C9C1 C8                                   ret     z               ; if negative then return with value as is reversed sign
 318++C9C2 2A A1 C7     .LL133:                 ld      hl,(varYX)      ; may not actually need this?
 319++C9C5                                      NegHL
 319++C9C5 AF          >                    xor a
 319++C9C6 95          >                    sub l
 319++C9C7 6F          >                    ld l,a
 319++C9C8 9F          >                    sbc a,a
 319++C9C9 94          >                    sub h
 319++C9CA 67          >                    ld h,a
 320++C9CB 22 A1 C7                             ld      (varYX),hl
 321++C9CE C9           .LL128:                 ret
 322++C9CF
 323++C9CF
 324++C9CF
 325++C9CF
 326++C9CF              ; Calculate the following: * If T = 0,  calculate (Y X) = (S R) / XX12+2 (actually SR & XX12+2 /256)
 327++C9CF              ;                          * If T <> 0, calculate (Y X) = (S R) * XX12+2
 328++C9CF              ;                          giving (Y X) the opposite sign to the slope direction in XX12+3.
 329++C9CF              ;
 330++C9CF              ; Other entry points:      LL121                Calculate (Y X) = (S R) / Q and set the sign to the opposite of the top byte on the stack
 331++C9CF              ;                          LL133                Negate (Y X) and return from the subroutine
 332++C9CF              ;                          LL128                Contains an RTS
 333++C9CF CD 2C CA     LL123:                  call    LL129                       ; Call LL129 to do the following: Q = XX12+2   = line gradient  A = S EOR XX12+3 = S EOR slope direction (S R) = |S R| So A contains the sign of S * slope direction
 334++C9D2 F5                                   push    af                          ; Store A on the stack so we can use it later
 335++C9D3 C5                                   push    bc                          ; If T is non-zero, so it's more horizontal than vertical, jump down to LL121 to calculate this
 336++C9D4 47                                   ld      b,a
 337++C9D5 3A 0C 67                             ld      a,(varT)                    ; instead : (Y X) = (S R) * Q *** this looks to be the wrong way roudn for Y!!!!
 338++C9D8 FE 00                                cp      0
 339++C9DA 78                                   ld      a,b
 340++C9DB C1                                   pop     bc
 341++C9DC C2 18 CA                             jp      nz, .LL122
 342++C9DF              ; The following calculates: (Y X) = (S R) / Q using the same shift-and-subtract algorithm that's documented in TIS2, its actually X.Y=R.S*256/Q
 343++C9DF 11 FE FF     .LL121:                 ld      de,$FFFE                    ; set XY to &FFFE at start, de holds XY
 344++C9E2 2A F1 66                             ld      hl,(varRS)                  ; hl = RS
 345++C9E5 3A F0 66                             ld      a,(varQ)
 346++C9E8 47                                   ld      b,a                         ; b = q
 347++C9E9              .LL130:                 ShiftHLLeft1                        ; RS *= 2
 347++C9E9 CB 25       >			   sla l
 347++C9EB CB 14       >			   rl  h
 348++C9ED 7C                                   ld      a,h
 349++C9EE 38 04                                jr      c,.LL131                    ; if S overflowed skip Q test and do subtractions
 350++C9F0                                      JumpIfALTNusng b, .LL132            ; if S <  Q = 256/gradient skip subtractions
 350++C9F0 B8          >                        cp      b
 350++C9F1 DA FC C9    >                        jp		c, .LL132
 351++C9F4 3F           .LL131:                 ccf                                 ; compliment carry
 352++C9F5 98                                   sbc     a,b                         ; q
 353++C9F6 67                                   ld      h,a                         ; h (s)
 354++C9F7 7D                                   ld      a,l                         ; r
 355++C9F8 DE 00                                sbc     a,0                         ; 0 - so in effect SR - Q*256
 356++C9FA 37                                   scf                                 ; set carry for next rolls
 357++C9FB 3F                                   ccf
 358++C9FC              .LL132:                 RollDELeft1                         ; Rotate de bits left
 358++C9FC CB 13       >               rl  e
 358++C9FE CB 12       >               rl  d
 359++CA00 38 E7                                jr      c,.LL130                    ;
 360++CA02 ED 53 A1 C7                          ld      (varYX),de
 361++CA06 F1                                   pop     af              ; get back sign
 362++CA07 ED 27 80                             test    $80
 363++CA0A C8                                   ret     z               ; if negative then return with value as is reversed sign
 364++CA0B 2A A1 C7     .LL133:                 ld      hl,(varYX)      ; may not actually need this?
 365++CA0E                                      NegHL
 365++CA0E AF          >                    xor a
 365++CA0F 95          >                    sub l
 365++CA10 6F          >                    ld l,a
 365++CA11 9F          >                    sbc a,a
 365++CA12 94          >                    sub h
 365++CA13 67          >                    ld h,a
 366++CA14 22 A1 C7                             ld      (varYX),hl
 367++CA17 C9           .LL128:                 ret
 368++CA18              ; The following calculates:  (Y X) = (S R) * Q using the same shift-and-add algorithm that's documented in MULT1
 369++CA18 3A 9C C7     .LL122:                 ld      a,(clipGradient)
 370++CA1B 32 F0 66                             ld      (varQ),a; optimise
 371++CA1E CD 10 6B                             call    HLequSRmulQdiv256
 372++CA21 22 A1 C7                             ld      (varYX),hl
 373++CA24 F1                                   pop     af
 374++CA25 ED 27 80                             test    $80
 375++CA28 CA 0B CA                             jp      z,.LL133
 376++CA2B C9                                   ret
 377++CA2C
 378++CA2C              ; Do the following, in this order:  Q = XX12+2
 379++CA2C              ;                                   A = S EOR XX12+3
 380++CA2C              ;                                   (S R) = |S R|
 381++CA2C              ; This sets up the variables required above to calculate (S R) / XX12+2 and give the result the opposite sign to XX13+3.
 382++CA2C 3A 9C C7     LL129:                  ld      a,(clipGradient)
 383++CA2F 32 F0 66                             ld      (varQ),a                    ; Set Q = XX12+2
 384++CA32 3A F2 66                             ld      a,(varS)                    ; If S is positive, jump to LL127
 385++CA35 E5 F5                                push    hl,,af                      ; else
 386++CA37 ED 27 80                             test    $80                         ;   if bit 7 is clear
 387++CA3A 28 0C                                jr      z,.LL127                    ;      RS = ABS RS
 388++CA3C 2A F1 66                             ld      hl,(varRS)                  ;      .
 389++CA3F                                      NegHL                               ;      .
 389++CA3F AF          >                    xor a
 389++CA40 95          >                    sub l
 389++CA41 6F          >                    ld l,a
 389++CA42 9F          >                    sbc a,a
 389++CA43 94          >                    sub h
 389++CA44 67          >                    ld h,a
 390++CA45 22 F1 66                             ld      (varRS),hl                  ;      .
 391++CA48 21 9D C7     .LL127:                 ld      hl,clipDxySign              ;   hl = dxy sign
 392++CA4B F1                                   pop     af                          ;
 393++CA4C AE                                   xor     (hl)                        ; a = S XOR clipDxySign
 394++CA4D E1                                   pop     hl
 395++CA4E C9                                   ret
 396++CA4F
 397++CA4F              ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 398++CA4F              ; Thow away out of bounds by more than 250
 399++CA4F              ClipLineV3:             ;break
 400++CA4F                      IFDEF       CLIPVersion3
 401++CA4F ~            ;My logic version
 402++CA4F ~            .CheckYorder:
 403++CA4F ~                                    ld      hl,(UbnkPreClipY1)
 404++CA4F ~                                    ld      de,(UbnkPreClipY2)
 405++CA4F ~                                    call    CompareHLDESgn
 406++CA4F ~                                    jr      c,.LineP1toP2                          ; if Y1 < Y2 then we can use the points as is else we have to swap
 407++CA4F ~            .LineP2toP1:            ld      bc,(UbnkPreClipY2)                      ; fetch and write out in reverse
 408++CA4F ~                                    ld      ix,(UbnkPreClipY1)
 409++CA4F ~                                    ld      de,(UbnkPreClipX1)
 410++CA4F ~                                    ld      hl,(UbnkPreClipX2)
 411++CA4F ~                                    ld      (UbnkPreClipY1),bc                      ; bc - XX15(2,3) Y1
 412++CA4F ~                                    ld      (UbnkPreClipY2),ix                      ; ix - XX12(0,1) Y2
 413++CA4F ~                                    ld      (UbnkPreClipX1),hl                      ; hl - XX15(0,1) X1
 414++CA4F ~                                    ld      (UbnkPreClipX2),de                      ;  de - XX15(4,5) X2
 415++CA4F ~                                    jp      .CheckNoClip
 416++CA4F ~            .LineP1toP2             ld      bc,(UbnkPreClipY1)                      ; bc - XX15(2,3) Y1
 417++CA4F ~                                    ld      ix,(UbnkPreClipY2)                      ; ix - XX12(0,1) Y2
 418++CA4F ~                                    ld      hl,(UbnkPreClipX1)                      ; hl - XX15(0,1) X1
 419++CA4F ~                                    ld      de,(UbnkPreClipX2)                      ; de - XX15(4,5) X2
 420++CA4F ~            .CheckNoClip:           ld      a,b
 421++CA4F ~                                    or      d
 422++CA4F ~                                    or      h
 423++CA4F ~                                    or      ixh
 424++CA4F ~                                    jp      nz,.CheckXOffScreen                 ; if both Y1 and y2 have bit 7 set
 425++CA4F ~                                    ld      a,c                                 ; then we clip
 426++CA4F ~                                    and     ixl
 427++CA4F ~                                    test    $80
 428++CA4F ~                                    jp      z, .ClipComplete
 429++CA4F ~            ;if either x1hi x2hi are 0 then we clip. if both <> 0and both same sign exit
 430++CA4F ~            .CheckXOffScreen:       ld      a,h
 431++CA4F ~                                    xor     d
 432++CA4F ~                                    test    $80                                 ; non descructive test of bit 7 is set
 433++CA4F ~                                    jp      nz,.X1X2OppositeSign                ; if bit 7 was set then x1 and x2 must be opposite signs so its on screen
 434++CA4F ~            .X1X2SameSigns:         ld      a,h                                 ; so to get there h and d must be the same sign
 435++CA4F ~                                    test    $80                                 ; if they are the same sign and at x1 is negative then x2 must be negative so off screen
 436++CA4F ~                                    JumpIfAIsZero .X1X2CheckIfBothRight
 437++CA4F ~            .X1X2BothNegative:      SetCarryFlag                                ; to get to here x1 and x2 must be high and off the same sign so its not to draw
 438++CA4F ~                                    ret
 439++CA4F ~            .X1X2CheckIfBothRight:  and     a                                   ; we have h in a already
 440++CA4F ~                                    jr      z,.X1OnScreen
 441++CA4F ~                                    ld      a,d
 442++CA4F ~                                    and     a
 443++CA4F ~                                    jr      z,.X2OnScreen
 444++CA4F ~            .X1X2OffRightSide:      SetCarryFlag                                ; to get to here x1 and x2 must be high and off the same sign so its not to draw
 445++CA4F ~                                    ret
 446++CA4F ~            ;                       to get to here x1 and x2 either span -ve to +ve or from on screen to off screen
 447++CA4F ~            .X1OnScreen:
 448++CA4F ~            .X2OnScreen:
 449++CA4F ~            .X1X2OppositeSign:
 450++CA4F ~            ;                       Now check to see if Y is off screen
 451++CA4F ~            .CheckYOffScreen:       ld      a,b                                     ; Check if y1 and y2 are opposite signs, fi so it spans screen so we are good
 452++CA4F ~            .CheckBothYNegative:    xor     ixh
 453++CA4F ~                                    test    $80                                     ; if bit 7 is set then opposite signs
 454++CA4F ~                                    jp      nz,.Y1Y2OppositeSign                    ; if y1 and y2 are opposite signs its on screen and spans at least one side
 455++CA4F ~            .Y1Y2SameSign:          ld      a,b                                     ; if they are the same sign then if one is negative, so is the other so off screen
 456++CA4F ~                                    test    $80
 457++CA4F ~                                    jp      z,.Y1Y2Positive
 458++CA4F ~            .Y1Y2Negative:          SetCarryFlag
 459++CA4F ~                                    ret
 460++CA4F ~            .Y1Y2Positive:          ld      a,c                                     ; if its the same sign y1 or y2 could be 0 and if they are
 461++CA4F ~                                    and     $80                                     ; this will test to see if b >0 or c > 127
 462++CA4F ~                                    or      b                                       ;
 463++CA4F ~                                    jp      z,.Y1OnScreen
 464++CA4F ~                                    ld      a,ixl
 465++CA4F ~                                    and     $80
 466++CA4F ~                                    or      ixh
 467++CA4F ~                                    jp      z,.Y2OnScreen
 468++CA4F ~            .Y1Y2OffBottomSide:     SetCarryFlag
 469++CA4F ~                                    ret
 470++CA4F ~            .Y1OnScreen:
 471++CA4F ~            .Y2OnScreen:
 472++CA4F ~            .Y1Y2OppositeSign:
 473++CA4F ~            .StartProcessing:       ld      hl,(UbnkPreClipX1)                      ; Now we can test and Clip
 474++CA4F ~                                    ld      de,(UbnkPreClipX2)                      ; de - XX15(4,5)
 475++CA4F ~                                    ld      iyh,0                                   ; set iyh flags to 0
 476++CA4F ~            ; if x1hi or y1 high <> 0 or y1 > 127 then set bit 1 of clipcoord       ; we can optimise this later
 477++CA4F ~                                    ld      a,h
 478++CA4F ~                                    or      b
 479++CA4F ~                                    jr      z,.CheckP1Ylo
 480++CA4F ~            ;                       iyh     bit 0 - P1 Needs Clipping
 481++CA4F ~            ;                               bit 1 - P2 Needs Clipping
 482++CA4F ~            ;                               bit 2 - x1 >= x2 (left to right)
 483++CA4F ~            ;                               bit 3 - y1 >= y2 (top to bottom)
 484++CA4F ~            ;                               bit 4 -  DY/DX (steep)
 485++CA4F ~            .P1OffScreen:           ld      iyh,1                                   ; if either p1 x or y was off screen set bit 0 to 1
 486++CA4F ~                                    jp      .CheckP2OffScreen                       ; .
 487++CA4F ~            .CheckP1Ylo:            ld      a,c                                     ; .
 488++CA4F ~                                    and     $80                                     ; .
 489++CA4F ~                                    jr      z,.CheckP2OffScreen                     ; .
 490++CA4F ~                                    ld      iyh,1                                   ; .
 491++CA4F ~            .CheckP2OffScreen:      ld      a,d                                     ; if x2hi or y2 off screen then set bit 2 of clipcoord to 1
 492++CA4F ~                                    or      ixh                                     ; .
 493++CA4F ~                                    jr      z,.CheckP2Ylo                           ; .
 494++CA4F ~            .P2OffScreen:           ld      a,iyh                                   ; .
 495++CA4F ~                                    or      2                                       ; .
 496++CA4F ~                                    ld      iyh,a                                   ; .
 497++CA4F ~                                    jp      .CheckXDirection                        ; .
 498++CA4F ~            .CheckP2Ylo:            ld      a,ixl                                   ; .
 499++CA4F ~                                    and     $80                                     ; .
 500++CA4F ~                                    jr      z,.CheckXDirection                      ; .
 501++CA4F ~                                    ld      a,iyh                                   ; .
 502++CA4F ~                                    or      2                                       ; .
 503++CA4F ~                                    ld      iyh,a                                   ; .
 504++CA4F ~            .CheckXDirection:       push    de,,hl
 505++CA4F ~                                    call    CompareHLDESgn                          ; IF HL equals DE, Z=1,C=0, IF HL is less than DE, Z=0,C=1, IF HL is more than DE, Z=0,C=0
 506++CA4F ~                                    pop     de,,hl
 507++CA4F ~                                    jp      c,.CalculateDx                          ;
 508++CA4F ~            .X1gteX2:               ld      a,iyh                                   ; if x1 >= x2 then set bit 3 to denote -ve x direction, note we will eliminate horziontal / vertical early as an optimisation
 509++CA4F ~                                    or      4                                       ; .
 510++CA4F ~                                    ld      iyh,a                                   ; .
 511++CA4F ~                                    ; Y Direction is now always top to bottom
 512++CA4F ~            .CalculateDx:           ClearCarryFlag                                  ;                       calculate DX
 513++CA4F ~                                    sbc     hl,de                                   ; .
 514++CA4F ~            .ABSDX:                 ld      a,h                                     ; HL = | HL - DE |
 515++CA4F ~                                    test    $80                                     ; .
 516++CA4F ~                                    jr      z,.DXPositive                           ; .
 517++CA4F ~                                    macronegate16hl                                 ; .
 518++CA4F ~            .DXPositive:            ex      de,hl                                   ; de = abs delta x
 519++CA4F ~            .CalculateDy:           ClearCarryFlag                                  ; hl = Y2 -Y1 as its pre sorted its always positive if on screen
 520++CA4F ~                                    ld      hl,ix                                   ; iy = hl = Y2 - Y1
 521++CA4F ~                                    sbc     hl,bc                                   ; .
 522++CA4F ~            .DYPositive:            ; Scale DX and DY to 8 bit, by here hl = abs dy, de = abs dx
 523++CA4F ~            ;calculate DY
 524++CA4F ~            .ScaleLoop:             ld      a,h                                     ; At this point DX and DY are ABS values
 525++CA4F ~                                    or      d                                       ; .
 526++CA4F ~                                    jr      z,.ScaleDone                            ; .
 527++CA4F ~                                    ShiftDERight1                                   ; .
 528++CA4F ~                                    ShiftHLRight1                                   ; .
 529++CA4F ~                                    jr      .ScaleLoop                              ; scaled down Dx and Dy to 8 bit, Dy may have been;;                                                                                               negative
 530++CA4F ~            .ScaleDone:             ; hl = ABS DY, DE = ABS DX,  bc = Y1, ix = Y2,   note H and D will be zero
 531++CA4F ~            ; if Dx = 0 then horizontal line and clip X1 & X2 only then exit
 532++CA4F ~            ; if Dy = 0 then vertical line and clip Y1 & Y2 only then exit
 533++CA4F ~
 534++CA4F ~            ; if DX < DY  gradient = 256 * delta_x_lo / delta_y_lo
 535++CA4F ~            ;        else gradient = 256 * delta_y_lo / delta_x_lo, set bit 5 of clipcord
 536++CA4F ~            .CalculateDelta:        ld      a,e                                     ; if DX < DY goto DX/DY
 537++CA4F ~                                    JumpIfALTNusng l,.DXdivDY                       ; else do DY/DX
 538++CA4F ~            .DYdivDX:               ld      a,l                                     ;    A = DY
 539++CA4F ~                                    ld      d,e                                     ;    D = DX
 540++CA4F ~                                    call    AEquAmul256DivD                         ;    A = R = 256 * DY / DX
 541++CA4F ~            .SaveGradientDYDX:      ld      (Gradient),a
 542++CA4F ~                                    ld      a,iyh                                   ;    bit 5 of iyh denotes that its a DX/DY (steep), if its clear its DY/DX (shallow)
 543++CA4F ~                                    or      16                                      ;    .
 544++CA4F ~                                    ld      iyh,a                                   ;    .
 545++CA4F ~                                    jp      .ClipP1                                 ;    .
 546++CA4F ~            .DXdivDY:               ld      a,e                                     ;    A = DX
 547++CA4F ~                                    ld      d,l                                     ;    D = DY
 548++CA4F ~                                    call    AEquAmul256DivD                         ;    A = R = 256 * DX / DY
 549++CA4F ~            .SaveGradientDXDY:      ld      (Gradient),a
 550++CA4F ~            ; if bit 1 of clipccord is set call    LL118
 551++CA4F ~            .ClipP1:                ld      a,iyh                                   ; if bit 1 is clear to say no need to clip pont 1 we just jump to point 2
 552++CA4F ~                                    test    1                                       ; .
 553++CA4F ~                                    jp      z,.ClipP2                               ; .
 554++CA4F ~                                    call    LL118v3                                 ; else clip P1 first
 555++CA4F ~                                    ld      a,b                                     ;      and if b or h have a value its failed to totally clip  as it may be only in bounds on just x or y
 556++CA4F ~                                    or      h                                       ;      .
 557++CA4F ~                                    jr      z, .P1Ygt127Check                       ;      .
 558++CA4F ~            .P1HighOutofBounds:     SetCarryFlag                                    ;      .
 559++CA4F ~                                    ret                                             ;      .
 560++CA4F ~            .P1Ygt127Check:         ld      a,c                                     ;      or if y > 127 its failed to totally clip
 561++CA4F ~                                    test    $80                                     ;      .
 562++CA4F ~                                    SetCarryFlag                                    ;      .
 563++CA4F ~                                    ret     nz                                      ;      .
 564++CA4F ~                                    ld      (UbnkPreClipY1), bc                     ;      else its valid and clipped point 1 so save ti back
 565++CA4F ~                                    ld      (UbnkPreClipX1), hl
 566++CA4F ~            ; if bit 2 of clipcoord is set
 567++CA4F ~            ;        swap x1y1 with x2y2
 568++CA4F ~            ;        call    LL118
 569++CA4F ~            .ClipP2:                ld      a,iyh                                   ; so now repeat all that for point 2
 570++CA4F ~                                    and     2
 571++CA4F ~                                    jp      z,.ClipComplete
 572++CA4F ~                                    call    LL118v3PreSwap                          ; now clip p2
 573++CA4F ~                                    ld      a,b                                     ; if either high is set then it failed to properly clip
 574++CA4F ~                                    or      h                                       ; .
 575++CA4F ~                                    jr      z, .P2Ygt127Check                       ; .
 576++CA4F ~            .P2HighOutofBounds:     SetCarryFlag                                    ; .
 577++CA4F ~                                    ret                                             ; .
 578++CA4F ~            .P2Ygt127Check:         ld      a,c                                     ; if c > 127 then it also failed to clip
 579++CA4F ~                                    test    $80                                     ; .
 580++CA4F ~                                    SetCarryFlag                                    ; .
 581++CA4F ~                                    ret     nz                                      ; .
 582++CA4F ~                                    ld      (UbnkPreClipY2), bc                     ; bc - XX15(2,3);;
 583++CA4F ~                                    ld      (UbnkPreClipX2), hl
 584++CA4F ~            ;clip compelte exit
 585++CA4F ~            .ClipComplete:          ld      bc,(UbnkPreClipY1)                      ; bc - XX15(2,3);;
 586++CA4F ~                                    ld      hl,(UbnkPreClipX1)
 587++CA4F ~                                    ld      ix,(UbnkPreClipY2)                      ; bc - XX15(2,3);;
 588++CA4F ~                                    ld      de,(UbnkPreClipX2)
 589++CA4F ~            .SaveClippedLine:       ld      a,c                                     ; Y1 = y1 lo, x2 = x2 lo, x1 = x1 lo y1 = y1 lo                                   -- Nothing off screen
 590++CA4F ~                                    ld      (UBnkNewY1),a
 591++CA4F ~                                    ld      a,ixl
 592++CA4F ~                                    ld      (UBnkNewY2),a
 593++CA4F ~                                    ld      a,l
 594++CA4F ~                                    ld      (UBnkNewX1),a
 595++CA4F ~                                    ld      a,e
 596++CA4F ~                                    ld      (UBnkNewX2),a
 597++CA4F ~                                    ClearCarryFlag                              ; we have a success so not carry
 598++CA4F ~                                    ret
 599++CA4F ~            ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 600++CA4F ~            LL118v3PreSwap:         ld      bc,(UbnkPreClipY2)                  ; bc - XX15(2,3);;
 601++CA4F ~                                    ld      hl,(UbnkPreClipX2)
 602++CA4F ~                                    jp      LL118v3Fetched
 603++CA4F ~            ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 604++CA4F ~            LL118v3:                ld      bc,(UbnkPreClipY1)                  ; bc - XX15(2,3);;
 605++CA4F ~                                    ld      hl,(UbnkPreClipX1)
 606++CA4F ~            ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 607++CA4F ~            LL118v3Fetched:
 608++CA4F ~            ;                       At this point bc = y position, hl = x position both 16 bit
 609++CA4F ~            ;                       if x < 0 then x = 0
 610++CA4F ~            ;                                     adjust = -x */ gradient depending on if its steep or shallow
 611++CA4F ~            ;                                     y = y +- adjust depending on if we are going +ve direction or negative direction  (or simplify it, that it will always be + for x1y1 and - for x2y2 as we pre-sort)
 612++CA4F ~            ;                       if x > 255 then x = 255
 613++CA4F ~            ;                                     adjust = x-255 */ gradient
 614++CA4F ~            ;                                     y = y +- adjust depending on if we are going +ve direction or negative direction  (or simplify it, that it will always be + for x1y1 and - for x2y2 as we pre-sort)
 615++CA4F ~            ;                       if y < 0 then y = 0
 616++CA4F ~            ;                                     adjust = -y */ gradient
 617++CA4F ~            ;                                     x = x +- adjust depending on if we are going left to right or visa versa
 618++CA4F ~            ;                       if y >127 then y = 127
 619++CA4F ~            ;                                     adjust = y-127 */ gradient
 620++CA4F ~            ;                                     x = x +- adjust depending on if we are going left to right or visa versa
 621++CA4F ~            ;
 622++CA4F ~            ;                       iyh     bit 0 - P1 Needs Clipping
 623++CA4F ~            ;                               bit 1 - P2 Needs Clipping
 624++CA4F ~            ;                               bit 2 - x1 >= x2 (left to right)
 625++CA4F ~            ;                               bit 3 - y1 >= y2 (top to bottom)
 626++CA4F ~            ;                               bit 4 -  DY/DX (steep)
 627++CA4F ~            ; if X1 hi <> 0
 628++CA4F ~            LL118:                  ;break
 629++CA4F ~                                    ld      a,h                                     ; if x1 high is 0 then we don't need to clip x at all
 630++CA4F ~                                    and     a
 631++CA4F ~                                    jp      z,.X1NoClipNeeded
 632++CA4F ~            ;                       if x1 hi bit 7 is set (so negative)
 633++CA4F ~            .CalcBlockX:            test    $80                                     ; if h is postiive then jump to the XPositive Calc block
 634++CA4F ~                                    jr      z,.CalcBlockXPositive
 635++CA4F ~            ;                       if clipccord bit 5 is set Adjust = abs(X1) / Gradient (may need to swap bit check?)
 636++CA4F ~            .CalcBlockXNegative:    ld      a,iyh                                   ;
 637++CA4F ~                                    test    16                                      ; bit 5 of iyh denotes that its a DY/DX, if its clear its DX/DY
 638++CA4F ~                                    jr      nz,.CalcBlockXNegMulGrad
 639++CA4F ~            .CaclBlockXNegDivGrad:  macronegate16hl
 640++CA4F ~                                    ld      a,(Gradient)
 641++CA4F ~                                    push    bc                                      ; abs(X1) / Gradient
 642++CA4F ~                                    ld      h,c                     ; move offset into high byte of h
 643++CA4F ~                                    ld      l,0
 644++CA4F ~                                    ld      c,a
 645++CA4F ~                                    call    div_hl_c
 646++CA4F ~                                    pop     bc
 647++CA4F ~                                    jp      .DoneXNegCalc
 648++CA4F ~            ;                       else set Adjust = abs(X1) * Gradient
 649++CA4F ~            .CalcBlockXNegMulGrad:  push    bc                                      ; abs(X1) * Gradient
 650++CA4F ~                                    macronegate16hl
 651++CA4F ~                                    ld      a,(Gradient)
 652++CA4F ~                                    call    HLeqyHLmulAdiv256
 653++CA4F ~                                    pop     bc
 654++CA4F ~            ;                       y1 += adjust * (-1 if bit 4 of clipcoord is set)
 655++CA4F ~            ;                       x1 = 0 then call into DonrX1Calc
 656++CA4F ~            ;                       we can skip the test for negative Y direection
 657++CA4F ~            .DoneXNegCalc:          macronegate16hl
 658++CA4F ~            .XNegSkipNegate:        ld      de,bc
 659++CA4F ~                                    ex      hl,de
 660++CA4F ~                                    add     hl,de
 661++CA4F ~                                    ld      bc,hl
 662++CA4F ~                                    ld      hl,0
 663++CA4F ~                                    jp      .DoneXCalc
 664++CA4F ~            ;                       else x1 hi is positive
 665++CA4F ~            ;                       if clipccord bit 5 is set Adjust = X1 lo / Gradient (may need to swap bit check?)
 666++CA4F ~            .CalcBlockXPositive:    ld      a,iyh
 667++CA4F ~                                    test    16
 668++CA4F ~                                    jr      nz,.CalcBlockXPosMulGrad
 669++CA4F ~            .CalcBlockXPosDivGrad:  ld      a,(Gradient)            ;Q = gradient
 670++CA4F ~                                    push    bc
 671++CA4F ~                                    ld      c,a
 672++CA4F ~                                    ld      de,255
 673++CA4F ~                                    sub     hl,de
 674++CA4F ~                                    ld      h,l
 675++CA4F ~                                    ld      l,0
 676++CA4F ~                                    call    div_hl_c
 677++CA4F ~                                    pop     bc
 678++CA4F ~                                    jp      .DoneX2Calc
 679++CA4F ~            ;                                 else set Adjust = X1 lo * Gradient
 680++CA4F ~            .CalcBlockXPosMulGrad:  push    bc
 681++CA4F ~                                    ld      a,(Gradient)            ;Q = gradient
 682++CA4F ~                                    ld      de,255
 683++CA4F ~                                    sub     hl,de
 684++CA4F ~                                    call    HLeqyHLmulAdiv256       ; hl = YX = SR / Q
 685++CA4F ~                                    pop     bc
 686++CA4F ~            ;                       y1 += adjust * (-1 if bit 4 of clipcoord is set)
 687++CA4F ~            ;                       x1 = 255
 688++CA4F ~            ;                       we can skip the test for negative Y direection
 689++CA4F ~            .DoneX2Calc:            macronegate16hl
 690++CA4F ~            .X2SkipNegate:          ex      de,hl
 691++CA4F ~                                    ld      hl,bc
 692++CA4F ~                                    add     hl,de
 693++CA4F ~                                    ld      bc,hl
 694++CA4F ~                                    ld      hl,255
 695++CA4F ~            ;                       if Y1 hi <> 0 or Y1 low >= 128 then y coordinate is good
 696++CA4F ~            .DoneXCalc:             ld      a,b
 697++CA4F ~                                    and     a
 698++CA4F ~                                    jr      nz,.CalcBlockY1Test
 699++CA4F ~                                    ld      a,c
 700++CA4F ~                                    and     $80
 701++CA4F ~                                    ClearCarryFlag                  ; speculative clear of carry in case its good
 702++CA4F ~                                    ret     z
 703++CA4F ~            ;                       if Y1 hi bit 7 is set
 704++CA4F ~            .X1NoClipNeeded:
 705++CA4F ~            .CalcBlockY1Test:       ld      a,b
 706++CA4F ~                                    test    $80
 707++CA4F ~                                    jr      z,.CalcBlockYPos       ; if Y is positive jump forward
 708++CA4F ~            ;                       if clipccord bit 5 is set Adjust = abs(Y1) / Gradient (may need to swap bit check?)
 709++CA4F ~                                    break
 710++CA4F ~            .CalcBlockY1:           ld      a,iyh
 711++CA4F ~                                    test    16
 712++CA4F ~                                    jr      nz,.CalcBlockYNegMulGrad
 713++CA4F ~            .CalcBlockYNegDivGrad:  macronegate16bc
 714++CA4F ~                                    ld      a,(Gradient)            ;Q = gradient
 715++CA4F ~                                    push    hl
 716++CA4F ~                                    ld      h,c                     ; move offset into high byte of h
 717++CA4F ~                                    ld      l,0
 718++CA4F ~                                    ld      c,a
 719++CA4F ~                                    call    div_hl_c;LLHLdivC;div_hl_c
 720++CA4F ~                                    pop     de
 721++CA4F ~                                    ex      de,hl
 722++CA4F ~                                    jp      .DoneBlockY1
 723++CA4F ~            ;                                 else set Adjust = abs(Y1) * Gradient
 724++CA4F ~            .CalcBlockYNegMulGrad:  macronegate16bc
 725++CA4F ~                                    push    hl
 726++CA4F ~                                    ld      hl,bc
 727++CA4F ~                                    ld      a,(Gradient)            ;Q = gradient
 728++CA4F ~                                    call    HLeqyHLmulAdiv256       ; hl = YX = SR / Q
 729++CA4F ~                                    pop     de
 730++CA4F ~                                    ex      de,hl
 731++CA4F ~            ;                       x1 += adjust * (-1 if bit 3 of clipcoord is set)
 732++CA4F ~            ;                       y1 = 0
 733++CA4F ~            ;                       ret
 734++CA4F ~            ;                       now we have done the adjustment, if y or x are off screen then the line spans screen in only 1 dimension so doesn't get drawn
 735++CA4F ~            .DoneBlockY1:           ld      a,iyh
 736++CA4F ~                                    test    4
 737++CA4F ~                                    jr      z,.Y1SkipNegate
 738++CA4F ~                                    macronegate16de
 739++CA4F ~            .Y1SkipNegate:          add     hl,de
 740++CA4F ~                                    ld      bc,0
 741++CA4F ~                                    ret
 742++CA4F ~            ;                       if clipccord bit 5 is set Adjust = Y1 lo / Gradient (may need to swap bit check?)
 743++CA4F ~            .CalcBlockYPos:         ld      a,iyh
 744++CA4F ~                                    test    16
 745++CA4F ~                                    jr      z,.CalcBlockYPosMulGrad
 746++CA4F ~            .CalcBlockYPosDivGrad:  ld      a,(Gradient)            ;Q = gradient
 747++CA4F ~                                    push    hl
 748++CA4F ~                                    ld      hl,bc
 749++CA4F ~                                    ld      de,127
 750++CA4F ~                                    sub     hl,de
 751++CA4F ~                                    ld      h,l
 752++CA4F ~                                    ld      l,0
 753++CA4F ~                                    ld      c,a
 754++CA4F ~                                    call    div_hl_c;LLHLdivC
 755++CA4F ~                                    pop     de
 756++CA4F ~                                    ex      de,hl
 757++CA4F ~                                    jp      .DoneBlockY2
 758++CA4F ~            ;                                 else set Adjust = Y1 lo * Gradient
 759++CA4F ~            .CalcBlockYPosMulGrad:  push    hl
 760++CA4F ~                                    ld      hl,bc
 761++CA4F ~                                    ld      de,127
 762++CA4F ~                                    sub     hl,de
 763++CA4F ~                                    ld      a,(Gradient)
 764++CA4F ~                                    call    HLeqyHLmulAdiv256       ; hl = YX = SR / Q
 765++CA4F ~                                    pop     de
 766++CA4F ~                                    ex      de,hl
 767++CA4F ~            ;                x1 += adjust * (-1 if bit 3 of clipcoord is set)
 768++CA4F ~            ;                y1 = 127
 769++CA4F ~            .DoneBlockY2:           ld      a,iyh
 770++CA4F ~                                    test    4
 771++CA4F ~                                    jr      nz,.Y2SkipNegate
 772++CA4F ~                                    macronegate16de
 773++CA4F ~            .Y2SkipNegate:          add     hl,de
 774++CA4F ~                                    ld      bc,127
 775++CA4F ~                                    ret
 776++CA4F                      ELSE
 777++CA4F C9                       ret
 778++CA50                      ENDIF
 779++CA50              ; old code for on screen test
 780++CA50              ;;;;;;; if y1 > 127 and y2 > 127 then same sing and exit
 781++CA50              ;;;;;;
 782++CA50              ;;;;;;;if y1hi y2hi are <> 0 and both same sign exit
 783++CA50              ;;;;;;.CheckYOffScreen:       ld      a,b                                 ; y1 and y2 high tests
 784++CA50              ;;;;;;                        and     ixh
 785++CA50              ;;;;;;                        jp      .CheckYLow
 786++CA50              ;;;;;;                        ld
 787++CA50              ;;;;;;                        and     a                                   ; if either is zero then we can check for > 127
 788++CA50              ;;;;;;                        jr      z,.YHighNegativeCheck               ;
 789++CA50              ;;;;;;                        ld      a,ixh                               ;
 790++CA50              ;;;;;;                        and     a                                   ;
 791++CA50              ;;;;;;                        ret     nz                                  ;
 792++CA50              ;;;;;;;if y1h bit 7 and y2h bit 7 set then exit as both -ve
 793++CA50              ;;;;;;                        ld      a,b                                 ;
 794++CA50              ;;;;;;                        and     ixh                                 ;
 795++CA50              ;;;;;;                        and     $80                                 ;
 796++CA50              ;;;;;;                        ret     z                                   ;
 797++CA50              ;;;;;;;if y1h > 0 and y2h > 0 then exit as both are +ve high
 798++CA50              ;;;;;;                        ld      a,b                                 ;
 799++CA50              ;;;;;;                        and     ixh                                 ;
 800++CA50              ;;;;;;                        ret     nz                                  ;
 801++CA50              ;;;;;;;if y1h or y2h is not 0 then proceed to clip
 802++CA50              ;;;;;;                        ld      a,b
 803++CA50              ;;;;;;                        or      ixh
 804++CA50              ;;;;;;                        jr      nz,.StartProcessing
 805++CA50              ;;;;;;;if (y1l bit 7 is set and y1h is clear ) or (y2l bit 7 is set and y2h is clear) the proceed to clip
 806++CA50              ;;;;;;                        ld      a,c
 807++CA50              ;;;;;;                        or      ixl
 808++CA50              ;;;;;;                        and     $80
 809++CA50              ;;;;;;                        jr      z,.StartProcessing
 810++CA50              ;;;;;;
 811++CA50              ;;;;;;.CheckYOffScreen:       ld      a,b                                 ;
 812++CA50              ;;;;;;                        cp      0                                   ;
 813++CA50              ;;;;;;                        jr      z,.Y1HighIsZero                     ;
 814++CA50              ;;;;;;                        ld      a,ixh                               ; if we get here Y1 high <> 0
 815++CA50              ;;;;;;                        cp      0                                   ;
 816++CA50              ;;;;;;                        jr      z,.Y2HighIsZero                     ; if they are both non zero we can do a sign check
 817++CA50              ;;;;;;.CheckYSameSign:        ld      a,b                                 ; if we get here Y1 high and Y2 high are not zero
 818++CA50              ;;;;;;                        xor     ixh                                 ; so same sign then bail out if they are
 819++CA50              ;;;;;;                        and     $80                                 ;
 820++CA50              ;;;;;;                        ret     z                                   ;
 821++CA50              ;;;;;;;if we get here either y1hi or y2 hi are 0, now check and y1 low > 127 & y2 low > 127, exit
 822++CA50              ;;;;;;.Y1HighIsZero:          ld      a,ixh                               ; as y1h is zero, if y2h is zero we do y1 y2 test
 823++CA50              ;;;;;;                        cp      0                                   ;
 824++CA50              ;;;;;;                        jr      nz,.Startprocessing                 ;
 825++CA50              ;;;;;;                        ld      a,c                                 ; so by here y1h and y2h must be zero
 826++CA50              ;;;;;;                        and     ixl
 827++CA50              ;;;;;;
 828++CA50              ;;;;;;                        .CheckY2Lo                        ;
 829++CA50              ;;;;;;.CheckY1Lo:             ld      a,c
 830++CA50              ;;;;;;                        and     $80
 831++CA50              ;;;;;;                        jr      z,.StartProcessing
 832++CA50              ;;;;;;.CheckY2Lo:             ld      a,ixl
 833++CA50              ;;;;;;                        and     $80
 834++CA50              ;;;;;;                        ret     nz
 835++CA50              ;;;;;;;clip = 0
# file closed: ../../Tests/3DTest/../../ModelRender/CLIP-LL145.asm
 377+ CA50              ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 378+ CA50                                      INCLUDE "../../Universe/Ships/CopyRotmatToTransMat.asm"
# file opened: ../../Tests/3DTest/../../Universe/Ships/CopyRotmatToTransMat.asm
   1++CA50              ; Set TransMatTo
   2++CA50              ; XX16(1 0)   (3 2)   (5 4)   = sidev_x sidev_y sidev_z XX16(13,12) (15 14) (17 16)
   3++CA50              ; XX16(7 6)   (9 8)   (11 10) = roofv_x roofv_y roofv_z XX16(7 6)   (9 8)   (11 10)
   4++CA50              ; XX16(13 12) (15 14) (17 16) = nosev_x nosev_y nosev_z XX16(1 0)   (3 2)   (5 4)
   5++CA50              ; This moves Side XYZ to position 0, Roof XYZ to position 1 annd nose XYZ to position 2 as a copy of each batch of 6 bytes
   6++CA50              ; 18 byte fast copy
   7++CA50
   8++CA50              ; Fast copy using the stack                                                         ; T states
   9++CA50 F3           CopyRotmatToTransMat:   di                                                          ; disable interrups to protect during copy
  10++CA51 DD 21 00 00                          ld      ix,0                                                ; 14
  11++CA55 DD 39                                add     ix,sp                                               ; 15
  12++CA57 31 29 C0                             ld      sp,UBnkrotmatSidevX ; Source                        ; 10
  13++CA5A E1                                   pop     hl                  ; UBnkrotmatSidevX              ; 10
  14++CA5B D1                                   pop     de                  ; UBnkrotmatSidevY              ; 10
  15++CA5C C1                                   pop     bc                  ; UBnkrotmatSidevZ              ; 10
  16++CA5D D9                                   exx                                                         ; 4
  17++CA5E E1                                   pop     hl                  ; UBnkrotmatRoofvX              ; 10
  18++CA5F D1                                   pop     de                  ; UBnkrotmatRoofvY              ; 10
  19++CA60 C1                                   pop     bc                  ; UBnkrotmatRoofvZ              ; 10
  20++CA61 31 6D C0                             ld      sp,UBnkTransmatRoofvZ+2 ; Target + 2 reversed       ; 10
  21++CA64 C5                                   push    bc                                                  ; 10
  22++CA65 D5                                   push    de                                                  ; 10
  23++CA66 E5                                   push    hl                                                  ; 10
  24++CA67 D9                                   exx                                                         ; 4
  25++CA68 C5                                   push    bc                                                  ; 10
